All Reviews

  1. Im a daily shaver, and this thing saved me so much time every morning. Self cleaning base is a great feature. change filter regularly. Best results on dry face, with the grain.
  2. I've had this shaver for two and a half weeks and I'm returning it. I shave my entire head, except for a goatee, and my testicles. I was hoping for a quicker shave than I get with a regular 3-blade manual safety razor. First off, it wound up taking longer than a manual razor. The one wide foil is not well suited to shaving a round skull and it takes a lot more passes to run the razor closely over all areas. Maybe the three floating heads of other brands may be better at covering all the spots. Second, the edger doesn't shave as closely as the blades, so to shape my beard I had to continue to use the safety razor if I didn't want the areas around the beard to be scruffier than the other parts of my face. Third, it shaves my testicles OK, but the the shaver really stings the seam between them. With extra effort I could get a decent shave. It gets an extra star for the liberal Panasonic return policy.
  3. This was my first attempt to use an electric shaver after about 10 years of conventional shaving. The shaver is unable to give me a clean shave especially around the curvy area just below the chin. I tried both dry and wet modes but couldn't get it to do my job. Applying more pressure causes a pain on the skin. If you are looking for a clean shave this is not the one. Next I'll probably try philips or go back to conventional:( The trimmer and self-cleaning features are good but main functionality is broken, so doesn't matter.
  4. I have been using an elecric razor since I was sixteen and I'm well itno my fourty's now. My father was a big Remington fan so I used that brand of shaver for many years. Then we got him a Norelco (Rotary) for Christmas one year and he loved it, so I switched to Norelco too. I had problems with both shavers in terms of skin irriatation but they did the job on my sensitve skin. Well, my last Norelco started losing power so I thought I would upgrade. I always wanted one of those fancy Braun's with the automatic cleaning/lubrication system but they are well over $200 -I did not want to upgrade that bad! In searchng Amazon for an alternative, I saw the Panasonic. The Panasonic products I've owned in the past have worked well, so I was open to the idea of a Panasonic shaver. Ordered and received the shaver in a very timely manner from Amazon.com and plugged it in for a charge. Gave it a try the next morning and I was immediately impressed. I like the weighty and substantial feel this razor has in my hand. It's also a good looking tool (always important). After a few days of using this razor my face was smooth and free of nicks or bumps. WOW! this thing really works! My face experienced zero irritation as a result of switching to this new razor. The micro fiol from Remington and the rotaries always chewed up my face until I got used used to them (translation: until I wore down the razores a a bit). but I had no irritation at all with the Panasonic. The cleaner is a bit bulky and noisey and there's really nothing slick about it; in fact its kind of ugly, but it works well! I set it to clean/charge/dry my razor and it came out sparkling new and shiny clean. Replacement blades, screens, and cleaning cartridges are fairly reasonable in price, so that is good. I also shaved using shaving foam but the results were not so good when I did. The foam gobed up the razor so it did not cut as closely as it could have. In fact, I was lsft with some pretty nasty stubble. I then began using Lab Series pre shave and once again I was extrememly impressed. I know that's another review but the point I am making is that you should get the best pre electric shave lotion (not foam) you can (avoid the drug store stuff if possible). Lab Series is great and has very low odor. It's about [...] a pop but it lasts a long time and works better than any other pre electric shave lotion I've tried. I am completely happy with this shaver and highyl recommend it.
  5. This is a great product.I am 60 yrs. old and have shaved with a blade ever since I began to shave.Of course I have tried an electric razor a few times,but they never got anywhere close as a blade.Over the years I have had several skin cancers removed from my face and head creating a surface that is none too pleasant to shave with a blade.About a month ago,I told my wife that I was going to try one more electric razor.After reading up on different razors and looking at the reviews,I decided to try the Panasonic.Best decision I have made in a long time.I use it in the wet mode and lather up with shaving creme just like I was going to use a blade. My face comes out as smoothe as a baby's behind.All I can say is try it,you will love it!!!!!!
  6. Razor give a close shave and it only took it a month to train my beard to be cut. Great Shaver.
  7. I don't think I need to spend a ton of time giving this the lauds and laurels it deserves, but it does deserve them. This was my first experience with a wet/dry razor, and it works very well. It is a bit louder than the electrics I've had in the past (I think this is due to the exceptionally fast rate the blades move at), but if you use it in the shower the noise isn't as bad as you'd think. I guess the bigger concern is the extra water wasted if you shave in the shower. Back on track, almost as smoother as with a regular razor, but without all the extra irritation on the neck. Best electric I've used (I've had braun and norelco models in this similar quality/price range and this is the best so far).
  8. I have a very tough beard. Usually, I have to shave with an electric razor first and then use a blade to finish it up. I have been trying different razors of all brands and costs for years, and nothing ever worked. Until now. This razor is incredbile. Even if I don't shave for a few days, it takes off everything clean and smooth. And I don't need to touch up with a blade afterwards. I am still shocked how well it works. In fact, this is the only review I have ever written on anything I purchased. That is how much I like this.
  9. It is a solid product. Close shave. Quiet compared to my past electric razors. The cleaning process takes about 45 minutes after each use. No complaints after using it for about 30 days.
  10. What I find remarkable is that over 200 people gave this a favorable review. What you might do before buying is to consider why over 30 people disliked it so much that they left a negative review. I'm such a sucker. I read so VERY MANY reviews, on this site and others, and I looked into all the \\"technology\\" that goes into the shavers. The concept and the name behind a thing does not make it an improvement. Whatever special shaving angle or cleaning technology the electronics companies might hawk as the latest thing might not translate into a better shave. In my case, I'm coming from using a regular non-electric razor. I wanted something that I could just pick up and shave with -- it would have to be fast and it would have to work both wet and dry. I got this shaver and tried it for about four weeks, wet and dry, many different configurations. It never worked for me. As other reviewers have said, it worked on parts of my face well but not others. I developed new areas of razor burn on my face (even in the fourth week) that I never had before. Also, I didn't like having some places on my face being shaved so close that it seemed like I shaved UP with a razor, while others seemed not fully shaved. So immediately after the shave I'd look sort of hacked up. This look would be accentuated after a few hours of growth. Also, to get even this poor quality of shave, I'd have to go over and over all areas of my face. It took me about three times as long as shaving with a normal razor, despite the fact that when I shave with a normal razor I have to get wet, wash my face, use shaving gel and after shave, etc. I just cannot understand the 200+ positive reviews. This thing actually works for some people?? Incredible. Well, my plan was to try it for 30 days and return it if it didn't work, and that's what I did. Amazon return was very easy. (My reason for return: \\"Does not work as advertised.\\") As for noise, cheap feel, and so on I agree with other negative reviews, but honestly I wouldn't mind if it were twice as loud and felt like a toy, so long as it could shave my face. Using a razor takes a fraction of the time and my face looks evenly and closely shaved every time.
  11. I purchased this razor specifically for the purpose of shaving my head and I have to say that I am glad I did! I have been using it for about 4 month's now and it works great. If you like the bald look but do not like using a regular razor on your head, then give this a try. I use it with either Williams Lectric Shave or Shave Secret shaving oil.
  12. The Vortex ended up being exactly what I thought it would be... A solid razor with a self contained cleaning unit for a decent price. I don't have much to add to the other reviews about the actual function of the razor. Long story short, it works. You may have sensitive skin or may not take well to an electric, but that's not the razor's fault. I haven't had any issues yet. My only complaint (the reason for the 1 star loss) is how loud and how long the cleaning process was. I've never had a self cleaning unit, so I really didn't know what to expect, but I figured the cleaning/drying cycle would take like 20mins tops. It was well over that, pushing about an hour. Also, it's a bit loud if you have it near your bed (mine's on the bottom shelf of my nightstand) or anywhere you wouldn't want to hear it. About the sound of somebody's loud vibrating cell on a glass table. Anyway, certainly not enough for me to make a return, I'll just keep it charged ahead of time and will put it in to clean when leaving for work in the AM.
  13. I finally switched from blades. I love this thing. I have been using it for 4 months so I can so for sure I am a convert. I can shave faster and get a great shave. I bought a high end Remington to leave at the gym and it is a joke compared to the Panasonic. I thought the self cleaning was a gimmick, but it it great.
  14. I have been searching for a good shaver for my head and face for years. I shave my head bald, and my beautiful face, lol. I have used many electric shavers over the years, even Braun for my head and face. This Panasonic ES8109S saves my head as close a razor blade. You cannot get any closer than this shaver for a nice smooth shinny head. I read reviews, researched and found many men recommend this Panasonic. Amazon had the best price, and free shipping, how can you go wrong? Excellent shaver, and it comes with a charging, and cleaning system, or you can clean it and charge it by hand and with the charging cord. You want the best shaver for you head, and face, get this shaver. Remember, God created a few beautiful heads, the rest, he put hair on!
  15. This shaver is absolute trash. To put it simply it does not shave at all, leaving behind huge patches of hair on my neck, underside of my head and also on my face. The only part of my face that it will actually shave well is my mustache or about 10% of the total area of skin I need to shave. I used it every day for three weeks and the results did not get better. The saddest part of all this is that this is the highest reviewed shaver on amazon, I have lost all hope for electric shavers don't waste your money on this worthless piece of junk.
  16. I purchased this shaver a year ago, and while I have traditionally preferred blades, I thought I'd give this one a try due to the positive reviews. After a year, I am reasonably pleased with the performance. I use it in a \\"dry\\" fashion, and the shave quality is good. Not as good as blades, but very close and with less irritation and no danger of cuts. The trimmer is close to useless, IMHO, but that isn't why I bought it anyway. Clean up is a snap using the base unit and cartridges. Generally, cartidges seem to last about a month with daily use, although I now manage quite a bit longer cartridge life by opening the shave head and rinsing off the bulk of the stubble in the sink before sticking it into the unit to be cleaned. After a year, the original blades that came with the unit are still cutting well.
  17. We've all heard the claims of a closer shave from so many razor manufactures that it doesn't phase us any longer. We've all tried many different types and styles to get that close shave.<br /><br />Look no further. I was surprised at the closeness of this razor. I used the Fusion razor in the shower to shave my head and under my chin for a close shave. I wanted to have something that if I was in a hurry and didn't have time to shower and shave; would give me the same results. This razor filled that request and went above.<br /><br />I love the self-cleaning system of the razor, and the fact that it also dries the razor.<br /><br />I am \\" scared \\" away from new things because most of the time it takes a degree in engineering to set things up. This razor set up with ease and I could understand the easy instructions; in English. I've returned merchandise before because the instructions in English consisted of two to three words and complete sentences in Spanish.<br /><br />The unit looks impressive and I realized that I had just purchased the best electric razor in my life, after several purchases.<br /><br />Do yourself a favor and surprise yourself.
  18. Closest shave I have ever had with an electric. Quiet, powerful, recharges quickly, and easy to clean. I use it every day!
  19. I normally don't write reviews, but I tend to benefit from them and this gadget blew me away. I've tried and failed over the years to find an electric shaver that could do the job as well as a razor. I thought it was physically impossible. Not so, as I came to find out. I am in the military. We shave everyday, and the old saying goes \\"a good soldier never needs a shave/haircut). This means you should always look clean shaven. I have coarse whiskers densely arrayed around my chin, with a light sprinkling elsewhere. This gives the appearance of someone attempting to start a goatee when the five o'clock shadow comes in. Like Joe Dirt, it's genetics. It also means I can't get away with a crappy shave, it makes the Joe Dirt effect much more pronounced. I've always used razors, usually a variation of the Sensor. I must be getting old because a vibrating safety razor with half a dozen blades that costs as much as car payment is not attractive to me. Said razors did the job well, but at a price. There is always a tradeoff. I tried different strokes and techniques but the end result was always the same - I would get razor bumps. To add insult to injury, some days I have to be up fairly early for physical training. This means I have to be clean shaven, but I don't want to shower first because I will get sweaty and have to shower anyway, which makes softening the coarse whiskers a dubious process at best because I am drowsy and in a hurry. This means shaving nicks in addition to ingrown hairs. Though I've grown proficient in the use of tweezers, the process grew tiresome. I thought there could be a better way, without lathering up and forgetting to pick up more razors when I run out. The hair on my face grows in one general direction, the ones at the base of my neck go in all directions of the compass. This shaver deals with them all nicely. The package arrived, I had everything out and ready to go and charged up in no time. I understood that this was a wet/dry shaverand I thought it would be a good idea to wet my face and use a thin cream to lube my mug for the big event. I turned it on and pressed it to my face and felt some pain with hairs pulling. I had a three day growth. Lesson one, use this for one or maybe two days' growth at most (for me, your mileage may vary). Lesson two, don't try to get fancy and use conventional shaving preparation methods. I used to mock this product, but get some Lectric Shave. It smells like old school aftershave and supposedly stands your whiskers up for the shave. I don't know if mine are standing up any more than usual, but it provides a lubricating quality to your skin which prevents razor burn when you have to go over the same spot several times, which you will be doing if you get any electric shaver. It works. I no longer deal with ingrown hairs, razor burn or nicks. Shaving (the actual act of removing hair) takes a few minutes longer, but it is well worth it and you don't have to do all the prep work, so in the end I would guess that this is actually quicker. After shaving I can bathe and wash my face and there is no burn where I shaved, even with soap on the same area. This is certainly a more flexible and forgiving arrangement. I've had this product for three weeks. The first few days I was not convinced, and even the product literature will tell you to stick with it. They were right. A 100% charge would appear to last for a while, I've not really tested it. When I begin it says 100%, when I send it home to clean up it still says 100%. On to the self contained cleaning system. I run it through a cleaning cycle everyday after shaving. I imagine it may reduce the life of some components, but it's cool as hell to have a machine do my dirty work for me. I shave, slap the shaver into the cleaning/charging unit and walk away. When I need it later it is dry and clean, even on the inside. I've checked. I will not bellyache about a few bucks for a detergent cartridge once in a while, butthat's me. If I get tired of doing that, then I can get analog and run it under tap water. Both will do the job. In summation, if you have similar grooming issues to deal with, you can buy this with confidence. No I am not a paid endorser, I'm just excited that I found a better mousetrap.
  20. It's been many years since I used an electric shaver, but I can still remember the irritation of the skin that I endured. Four months ago I had carotid surgery that left the left side of my neck numb, making use of a blade razor a bit touchy. I bought this razor and am totally satisfied with how it shaves. No irritation. Clean shave with minimum effort. And, best of all, no concern about cutting my neck!
  21. I bought this razor as a Gold Box Deal of the day because the price was right and I needed a new shaver. I was a bit skeptical at first because of all of the good reviews that it had. I used it for the first time yesterday and was very very happy with how close of a shave that it actually got. I have not had a closer shave with an electric razor than this and even my girlfriend commented that my face was more smooth than usual. The cleaning system is pretty good too. I would recommend this for anyone who is looking for a great electric shaver at a reasonable price. Good purchase indeed!
  22. Based on the reviews here on Amazon I was hoping to get a shaver that would not give me razor burn and help me save money on razor blades. I was also hoping my wife could even use it. My wife tried to use it twice. I can't tell you what my wife said about this product on here. I found that I have to run the shaver over my face very slow, make 4 to 5 passes over the same area and press the shaver to my face with a lot of force. It is especially bad on the neck. I use to be able to shave in a couple of mins, now it takes about 10 mins. It does shave as close as a razor but I noticed it misses single whiskers. Feels odd to find a single whisker just above your lip or on your cheek. LOL. I would have returned this product but when I checked the shipping and restocking fee, it would have been even a bigger lose than keeping it. I use Gillette Shave Gel with Glycerin when I shave in the hot shower. Not using it causes the shaver to stick to my face. In other words it won't just glide across my skin without the use of the shaving gel. After shaving I noticed I had several nicks on my face, like I had used a dull razor blade. Very disappointing. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
  23. I have never used an electric razer before so this was a change of pace for me... I got this one due to the fact that it's a wet/dry shaver and shaving in the shower just seemed like a great idea. the only problem is the dock is loud and takes forever... i know everyone already mentions that but yeah it's crazy loud
  24. Panasonic sent me this razor (factory refurbished) to replace (under warranty) another razor that didn't shave either my legs or my husband's beard. They provided customer service after I was persistent about the other shaver (now discontinued).
  25. This is the closest shave I have ever gotten from an electric razor. Other than being loud, this is a great product. I switched from razor blade to this electric razor and experienced no discomfort even the first time I used it. Highly recommended!
  26. I have coarse hair and i'm generally pretty hairy. This shaver is next to useless for trimming, it really only works if you're trying to shave off a slightly-more-than-a-5-o-clock-shadow. So unless I shave every 2 days, this shaver isn't that great. I have to run through 5-6 times for a close enough shave (this is NOT a close shaver) and it sometimes burns.
  27. Bought this for my husband and he loves it. Best razor he has ever owned. It shave very clean but does have trouble getting the area below his nose. Likes that it is self cleaning.
  28. This shaver work fantastically and waterproof. I would say shaving is easier with this product than using razors. Note that I do not use the Hydraclean, because it may be gross to use the same liquid for cleaning without changing to in 30 days. So I decided clean manually instead of using it. You may consider buying the version without hydraclean system.
  29. Get the Panasonic ES8103S Men's 3-Blade shaver instead. This model with the cleaning unit is bulky and the cleaning unit is unnecessary since it comes with a brush plus since it is wet/dry shaver you can clean it by just using soap and water on the blade area. One problem with this unit and the Panasonic ES8103S Men's 3-Blade shaver is that it has a light that flashes after its charged so you cannot keep it plugged in all the time. No electric shaver is going to shave as close as a blade and will require several passes to get the job done. I have a light beard and still it requires sevreral passes over the same spot. I thought I'd like the floating pivoting head but after the novelty wore off in a few days I put it in the lock position so that it would stay steady. It is a good as a my former Braun and the replacement parts (blades/foils) are less expensive.
  30. This is my first review EVER so you know I must be ecstatic about this shaver !!! I would give it 5 stars but to me that is just something one strives for. Anyway I get a really close shave with the ES8109S and the cleaning system is awesome.
  31. This is the second Panasonic electric razor I've purchased. The first one was the ES8103 (same model as this but without the charger/cleaner). I use this one and my teenage son uses the other. We are both extremely satisfied. Previously I used Braun razors, but when my Braun finally broke (battery stopped taking a charge), I switched to Panasonic. The shave is every bit as good as the Braun, and the Panasonic is about $100 to $150 LESS! Both the Braun and the Panasonic use a straight vibrating cutter, so switching is easy.
  32. I used Norelco shavers + Braun shavers for 15 years. None even compare to the Panasonic Vortex shavers. These simly are the best. They shave your face very evenly and do not tear up your neck like the Norelco ones. My face is very sensitive and this one never irritates it. I use no shave cream or pre shave and shave dry. It is great for on-the-go shaving.<br /><br />I highly recommend this shaver!
  33. I switched over to this model of electric shaver last week because I was sick and tired of spending 15 dollars on 4 gilette fusion razor blades that were only lasting me 4 shaves before destroying my face. Knowing that Panasonic shavers were available for using wet with lotion, and having tried one dry (which I was decently impressed by) I decided to take the plunge and order this thing for 100 dollars. 1st Shave: Ouch. I was excited as a kid on christmas when this thing got to my house, and made the mistake of attempting to shave with it dry, since I didn't have time for a shower. It did a fine job on my face. My neck looked like somebody had tried to lynch me, and it took about 4 days for the cuts and the razor burn to heal. My fault though, even back when I used a Norelco it was a cool skin model and I didn't use it unless I had just showered. That left me with razor burn too. Disappointed, I figured I'd wait it out to see what happened. 2nd Shave: WOW!!! Well, after waiting three days for my face to heal up, I showered, splashed on some lectric shave, and mixed some Edge Advantage Revitalizing Cream with an even amount of Neutrogena razor defense shave cream and had at it. Face was WAY smoother in a short period of time. The neck still burned, but this time I was prepared with post shave lotion and that helped out greatly. Also, allowing the lectric shave 30 -45 seconds on the neck and face before applying the cream helped me get a LOT closer on the sides of the neck, under the jaw, and on the face. I was pretty happy with that shave, and thought that once my neck, and particularly my adams apple got used to it, this thing would be awesome. So I went looking for slicker, longer lasting shave gels and other things to help set my beard up, leading me to shave 3. 3rd Shave: This one wasn't as good as the second, but not as bad as the first. After buying some neutrogena razor defense face scrub (for use before shaving) and some Nivea For MenHI-PERFORMANCE X-TREME shaving gel I figured I'd have the winning combo nailed. Wrong. The foam was thick, which I'm sure gunked up the blades resulting in me having to go over my face and neck more, resulting in more irritation. To make matters worse, that pre-shave scrub only seemed to dry my skin out, which coupled with some razor bite and an alcohol based pre shave did not end well. I did, however, notice that despite how my neck FELT, it looks like it's improving with every shave in terms of adapting to the irritation. Still not \\"AS CLOSE AS A BLADE WITHOUT THE IRRITATION!!\\" like so many of these companies claim. I will probably come back to this review later to update it, but for now all I can say is that the performance of the shaver is EXTREMELY important to me, over aesthetics, cleaning systems, and all that other stuff. My beard isn't super thick, but it's definitely thick enough to ware down Gilette Fusion blades by the third shave, and after the fourth the blade is useless. That said, after just a shower and either of the previously mentioned shave creams(neutrogena or edge advantage) I was getting the most absolutely perfect shave you could think of or envision. In comparison, I am still letting my skin get used to this. I've had this new shaver for a week, and I've used it three times. My skin DOES seem to be adjusting, but it seems to be extremely important that you first have the razor cleaned, as the shaving solution also acts as a kind of lubricant, or so it seems. Second, DON'T use this thing dry if you have issues with electrics beating up your neck. My old norelco did this, and even the perfect gilette fusion nicked my neck every now and then at the adams apple, same spot this thing is having issues. Thirdly, use a thin shaving cream or gel that stays slippery. Clinique and Billy Jealousy, as well as Zihr, are all supposed to have great ones that provide excellent razor glide, although they are expensive, and I haven't yet tried them. Edge advantage seems to no longer be in production, which is unfortunate. Neutrogena razor defense cream has worked well for me though. Thin is important though, as a thick gel will clog the razor. Fourth, a pre-electric solution like Lectric Shave, Afta, or any of the others out there seems to make a difference. I can't feel it on my skin until after the shave when I notice how much smoother my face is compared to when I don't use it. Lastly, get a really really good soothing after shave balm. Neutrogena's isn't bad, but it doesn't cool. Nivea is supposed to have a good cooling one, and again Billy Jealousy is supposed to have good after shave balm as well. If you feel like spending 22 dollars on it, I have heard rave reviews for the clinique post shave healer. Ultimately, I bought this razor to save money on fusion blades, which are costing me a reasonable chunk of cash. That and the fact that I love different electronic gadgets and this thing fit the bill and sounded great, so I took the plunge. It is NOT as thorough as a razor in my opinion, nor is it as fast. That said, I have still only had it for 6 days, and have only used it three times. Stubble seems to grow back quicker, which would infer the shave isn't as close. Despite this, my face feels smooth as velvet after use, despite some irritation. The irritation is a major issue though on the neck and adams apple. My neck is shaved just fine, my adam's apple is tough though, and the razor burn on both afterwards exceeds my face. In the end though, a good post shave lotion can take care of that quickly. Cheaper than buying tons of blades, but more irritation if you aren't used to electrics. Also, the money you spend trying to find the right kind of pre shave, during the shave, and after shave lotions could add up quickly. These are my opinions, everybody has a different beard type, different skin type, etc. I have a friend who's been shaving for the past 8 years with a braun syncro and has no issues with it, and gets close. He started using it at 14 though and hasn't stopped, so I imagine he's used to it. I used a rotary electric from 13 to 15 and then went back to a blade until last week, a little less than two months from my 22nd birthday, and my face is having a tougher time. But, amazon does give you time to return this thing, so if you want to, try it. If it doesn't work, back it goes, if it does, then you're set, so you don't have anything to lose. EDIT: After the fourth shave I've had enough. The razor does a nice enough job on the face, but it murders anything below my jaw line. After two light passes with it on my neck I began bleeding and was left with a big red smile looking mark from one side of my neck to the other. Again. Also, with all the passes needed to actually cut the hairs, shaving with this razor took me FAR longer than with a blade, so back to blades I go. Apparently with a brush, rubbing alcohol, a dry cloth, and a dry place to store your razor you can extend the blade life by two to three times it's usual life. Sounds like that's what I'll be doing from now on. I really wanted this razor to be awesome and do what it said it does, but frankly it falls well short. I don't know who Panasonic is kidding when they talk about \\"one pass shaving\\".
  34. After much research, I purchased this shaver to replace my dying Norelco wet/dry shaver. I've used Norelco's all my life and they've done the job, but I've always thought they could do a bit better. This Panasonic shaver has given me the best shave I've ever had, very close and comfortable without having to go over the same area over and over again. Factor in that you can use it dry or in the shower (which you can't with a Braun), and the great price, and I don't see how you can do better than this shaver.

I'm going back to Braun...

I have to go over my face a few times but it gives a close comfortable shave. I use it wet, usually with King of Shaves shaving oil on my face. Used wet there is no skin irritation. Although the shaver did not indicate a need for it, I used the Hydraclean system. It is a little noisy but appears to do a satisfactory job.   40. I have used this razor now for three months. Hard to imagine being happier. I have owned about half a dozen electric razors over the past 25 years and this one is by far the best. It gives the closest shave I have ever had. Also gives the fastest shave; taking fewer passes over my beard than any other electric I ever had. The battery is good for well over a week. The handle is a pleasure to hold. Out of habit I still manually clean this razor every day, and so have only used the HydraClean system once. It seemed to work fine and was easy to use. I literally have no complaints about this product.
  41. I have been using a Norelco for as long as I can remember and was satisfied with it thinking that this was as good as it gets with an electric. It was never as good as a blade but I figured that was good enough for me. Well when my last Norelco died after only a year I decided to try another. I purchased an Braun series 400 from walmart and the thing was not right, so I took it back and got another one. When this one was the same as the first I started looking and found the Panosonic wet/dry. All of the reviews were very good so I decided to order one from Amazon. When it arrived I took it in a started to charge it, and one of the first things I noticed was that the cleaning solution was not combustible like the Braun and that made me feel a bit better. Another thing I liked is that the Panosonic charged quickly and I could leave plugged in unlike the Braun which should only be plugged in when charging. Now it was time to test the Panosonic in the critical shave test. I am glad to report that it passed the test with flying colors. I was surprised to find how smooth a shave it gave. The first test was dry, and then the next cut I used it wet with shaving cream. Either way ya go, this Panosonic does exactly what it says it will do. I shave twice a day and it is great being able to use it in the shower. I have been using it for about a month now and I like it as much as I did the first day I got it. It looks like shaving with a Norelco again is not in my future as it never cut as good as this Panosonic does either wet or dry. The only negative is that when the self cleaning function is on it makes enough noise to keep me awake, but being the genius I am it only took me two times to just close the bathroom door so I could not hear it in the bathroom. At a better price than the Braun and about the same as the Norelco the Panosonic gives a better shave hands down. After ordering it a Amazon.com I was happy with how quickly it was shipped and at my front door.
  42. Well let me start by saying I have owned many electical shavers before that I thought were wonderful, but this one unlike the others, really is. I have tried salves, electric, manual, and just about everything else, this shaver however, has reduced the red marks and bumps on my neck almost completely. When it comes to negative thoughts? I really can't think of any at all.

  50. From experience with other electric shavers, this one blows away the competition.Listed below are the advantages<br /><br />1- Overall the contour shape of the shaver fits in the contour of your hand.This gives an excellent grip. Bonus feature, the unit is very very light.<br />2-The flexibility to use dry/wet is a plus. Unlike Braun, this shaver gives the flexibility to shave in the shower, with a gel or dry shave whereby giving the end user total flexibility and convenience. However when using a gel, it shaves super close, and can rub on the skin, which can lead to skin burns. Dry/wet is good enough.<br />3- The nono technology are phenomenal. I feel its better than shaving with a Mach3 . The skin feels soft after a shave. However, one has to run the shaver over the neck more than once to reach the contour areas. It gets them. Braun didn't even come close, no matter how many passes you made.<br />4- The indicator shows a tap sign when the trimmer needs to be cleaned. Just run it under the tap and whola in 20 secs, the shaver is clean.<br />5- One negative feature is the inability to shave when the unit is being charged. I guess this is a safety feature.<br /><br />So overall...A++ for closeness of shave, as good as a blade.<br />Practical , flexible, looks nice and blows away the competition. Now tell me how many shavers can you buy that does all this for under $100 (2007 Dec price on Amazon)
  51. I have been a Braun customer for YEARS.....it came time to replace the foil on my razor and I was never completely satisfied with the shave I received from my Braun, instead of spending money on my old razor I decided to buy a new one. I researched new razors and saw a lot of favorable comments connected to the Panasonic Vortex, so I decided to try it. I bought this razor and have been COMPLETELY satisfied with it. I only wish I would have changed from Braun to Panasonic years ago. This is the first wet/dry electric razor I have owned and I must say that the closeness of the shave with shaving cream is incredible. I will absolutely buy another Panasonic when time necessitates it.
  52. I switched to an electric because of the amount of irritation I get from a straight razor. I have used this razor for about a month now and it is nothing short of awesome! I hardly get any irritation from using this thing. I am totally pleased with my purchase. Good product.
  53. I've only had this for a few days, but it's easily the best shave from an electric that I've ever had. Hard to beat now that it's $99. Goodbye Braun Activator...
  54. I've been using Panasonic shavers for 10 years. I use them in the shower every morning and find I get a closer shave than with any other shaver I've ever used, and I've tried every major brand of electric shaver. As long as you use soap (nearly any soap will do) you will get an incredibly close shave that lasts all day. It even beats the 5-blade razors. The only complaint I have is that the batteries will only last about a year and then the shaver goes dead. There is no way to replace the batteries so you just have to throw the shaver away and get a new one. The longest I ever had a Panassonic shaver last was 18 months, but most of them died within 12 months. I replaced the blades and shaving head once after a year thinking I could keep using the shaver for another year, but it died. So I suggest that you don't replace the blades, just replace the whole shaver. Despite this shortcoming I keep buying a new one each year because the shave is so great. Oh, in case you think I wasn't charging the shaver correctly I was. I did the original charge for the recommended time and usually charged it once a week thereafter. I've had friends use the Panasonic shavers with the same results...close shaves but they go dead in a year.
  55. My sister and I carefully researched Wet/Dry Shavers in a quest to find one that our dad would like. He's had several different types of electric and rechargeable razors over the years and his chief complaint is that after a week or two, they no longer provide him with a close shave. So, we read good reviews about the Panasonic shaver and decided to purchase one as a Father's Day gift for him. Turns out he loves the shaver! He said it is giving him the best shaves he's had in years! And now he's actually had it for over a month and still loves it! So, I would highly recommend this shaver.
  56. I have been on and off electric shavers over the years (almost exclusively Norelco). For about the last 5 years, I've been shaving with the Gillette Fusion razor (or variants thereof). While happy, I was tired of spending 20 bucks on a pack of blades. I wanted a wet/dry electric shaver and was looking at the Braun and Panasonic. I just couldn't see spending the $200 plus for the Braun so, after reading several reviews here, decided on the Panasonic. I have NOT been disappointed!! I'm sure the Braun is a fine razor but all I can say about the Panasonic is...WOW! It shaves every bit as close as a blade...maybe even more so...and it doesn't irritate my skin. I don't ever remember my Norelco razors giving me this close of a shave. As for the cleaner, I read a review on here that said it was difficult to use...HUH? It is VERY easy. Just fill the container with water and shove a detergent cartridge in. DONE! The ONLY downside I can think of is the razor doesn't seem to hold a charge for very long, so don't travel any more than a couple of days without the charge cord (the same cord that powers the cleaning/recharging base will also charge the razor itself...so you don't need to travel with the somewhat bulky base if you don't want to). Hope this review helps...I know you won't be disappointed with this purchase!
  57. I traded from a dry shave Braun electric rechargeable unit to this. My Braun died due to age and use. In regards to shave closeness, I think my old Braun has a slight edge. The ergonomics of this shaver is very well designed and better than my Braun. The hydraclean system, self cleaning, is a nicety but is not a critical need in my opinion and is probably why it is priced the way it is. Number of shaves between recharge is about average but my old Braun out performs the Panasonic in this arena as well. If you are a simple guy looking for a decent shaver at a good price, you can find just as good or better at a lower price. I classify this product as one that the wife would probably buy as a gift for your father-in-law....beats getting another neck tie I suppose.
  58. I've had a Remington for the last 6 years and finally upgraded to this at the recommendation of family who also have it. It takes a little longer for me to shave now (5 minutes instead of 3), but it's a lot closer than before, and the cleaning kit keeps it fresh and sharp. Also, it's a lot quieter than I expected, a plus! I don't like that the cleaning kit requires refills every 6 months, but that's the nature of the beast.
  59. This was my first shaver, I got it after extensive research on which shavers to get. The first time I tried it, It took me a while to get use too and took me about an hour to shave my beard off. My hair was long so it wasn't to bad and I never had to re-rinse or clean off the hairs like i did with a traditional wet shaver. Keeping it short is a different story when it come to speed. its pretty quick once the hair is short. The next was a bit difficult cause it is hard to get the exact direction my hair is going. As for irritation, i did not get to much of that other then it pulling my hair once or twice while it was long. Also don't force it on your face to get a closer shave unless you want a burn mark on your neck (learned that the hard way lol.) If you keep going over the same spot gently (not baby gently but you know, normally.) you should be able to get a really close shave. At times i find my self really impressed on how close of a shave I get from this bad boy. but they are off days where I guess i don't put in the effort for a close shave and i keep a 5 o'clock shadow after shaving. I am unsure why i get different results even now but I think that is more my fault then the item cause I have gotten some pretty damn close shaves with this thing. after a few tests using this razor dry I decided to grow out my bread and try it wet. Granted i did not have a mirror in the shower but it did not work as well as i hoped it too. It did shave my bread off after a while but it took a lot longer then i expected. I concluded that it is better as a dry shaver. The cleaning system works great though, although its a bit noisy but hey at least i can make it do that while i go to work, so I don't have to listen to it :) This is my first electric shaver so I cannot comment about how loud it is or how big it is, although it was bigger then i originally. thought. I got this product in June, and I am really happy with the purchase and I believe itis well worth it. 4/5 stars.
  60. i use it on my legs and i have to say it's pretty good. the charge lasts for two legs, but mine are short with course hair :^) if you have amazon women legs and your hair is course you may have to charge it once more(takes about a ten to fifteen minutes to recharge). i am very happy with the purchase- it really gives you a smooth shave.

  62. I've always been skeptical about electric shavers due to the fact that all of the ones I've had in the past were unreliable and didn't give a close shave. More often than not the others that I've tried in the past would leave me with ingrown hairs and razor bumps. They seemed to struggle with my coarse beard, and would get dull after just a few uses. Not this one! This new Panasonic Vortex is a totally different story. It is hands down the best shaver that I've ever owned. It is incredibly fast and provides the closest shave that I've ever gotten from an electric shaver. And, I don't get the ingrown hairs and irritation that others have given me in the past. This is one close shaving machine and very fast. The charge life is amazing as well. After shaving my face and head, it still had 80% charge remaining. Its speed makes it noticeably faster because one or two passes and you have a razor blade close shave without pulling and tugging on your beard. I have a very coarse beard and it doesn't seem to bog down this shaver at all. It just buzzes right on through effortlessly. As I mentioned, I use it on my scalp too. It is awesome in that aspect too as it gives an incredibly close shave with no irritation. The wet dry option makes it even better, and I seem to get a closer (straight razor close) shave using it in the shower with a shaving gel. I've been use Nivea Active3 shampoo body wash and shave gel all in one with it with no issues whatsoever. For the price, this is well worth it to have such a reliable, fast, and powerful shaver. I love mine, I think you will too.

  75. The reason I purchased this shaver was to find a solution to the acne or bumps that I have around my mouth. I previously owned a Norelco with the 3 rotating heads. I read that the lift and cut feature of the Norelco contributed to bumps since the hair is now below skin level and would curl and grow under the skin. I tried manual razors which took too much \\"prep work\\" and had that rough feeling afterwards. I tried this linear shaver and it still cuts surprisingly close. The acne continued so I had to experiment and switched to a different moisturizer which helped to improve my skin a lot. I believe it was a combination of shaver, cutting technique, post shave product and moisturizer that was necessary to solve my problem. 1. Use shaving gel (not only does it give help the razor glide more easily, it lubricates the blades so that they won't get damaged) 2. Do not stretch the skin. This may contribute to ingrown hairs. 3. Shave against the grain, then with the grain. (this ensures the hair will grow the same way and helps to prevent ingrown hairs) 4. After washing up use after shave even though this is an electric razor. 5. Make sure moisturizer is non-comedogenic. I rated this -1 star since this shaver did manage to cut a white-head due to the middle blade.
  76. I love this product and would recommend it to a friend. Shaves as close as a blade and much more comfortable.
  77. I was given this shaver as a Christmas gift, and I generally like it. It provides me with a much closer shave than I get with my Braun Synchro electric razor. However, if I let my beard grow out too much (more than 4 or 5 days for me), this shaver will painfully tear out my long facial hair. In fact, it is so unpleasant to use either the shaver or the beard trimmer function of this razor to shave long facial hair that I need to use my Braun Synchro. Despite this flaw, I'm giving the razor 4 stars to reflect its superior performance with short facial hair.
  78. I read all the reviews before purchasing this shaver. The rave reviews were true and the use of this shaver is great. It took me a couple or three weeks to learn my whisker growth pattern.   82. I had been leery of buying an electric razor for several years, after using Brauns for many years, then switching back to a blade because no electric razor shaves as close as a blade... Like most guys, I don't like shaving, but I like a clean-shaven face. So I started shopping electrics again. I was close to buying a Braun Series 7, when I happened on a review of the Pany ES8109S. After a lot of research, I threw down on this razor based on several reviews and Panasonic's description (13,000 rpm wet/dry razor?!?). I received the razor after just three days, using the free Super Saver shipping and used it the following day. Usually it takes your face several shaves to get used to a new razor and so, takes a little extra time to get close; after only a few minutes of shaving, my face was smooth (almost as close as a blade). I waited several days to shave again, so when I did, I had a lot of long stubble. I decided to try using Edge shave gel with my new razor. It's a bit messy, but well worth it. My face felt super smooth and soft afterward! This razor is AWESOME (as far as electric razors go) and I highly recommend it. Never been more satisfied with any purchase I have ever made (and am very glad I didn't spend $200 plus on a Braun)

  84. My facial hair is so thick that I always have a hard time finding a razor that lasts, but I've been using this for 7 months now and haven't had any problems. It has a very delicate feel on the face, but don't be fooled. It's a trimmin, choppin' machine that does provide a great close shave. With some of the other electric razors I've used, I always had to go over my face with a regular blade but this guy almost always gets everything - and if it doesn't, the handy trimmer can usually get the tricky spots. It even works pretty good on the neck!<br /><br />The charger looks ridiculously big, but it also comes with a more travel friendly charger. I haven't really used the cleaning system, so if that's the selling point for you then you might actually think if you'll use it or not.<br /><br />Overall it is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for.. and it's still cheaper than a couple months worth of blades.
  85. I have never had much luck in the past with electric razors and I mean distant past.<br /><br />I have a weird beard in that the hairs are on the wire y side but not dense and they grow in all different directions.<br /><br />I hate shaving to begin with - so when I saw the ads for these shavers & started reading the reviews, I decided to give it a try.<br /><br />The very first shave was done completely dry and did better than I expected. My neck and face were mildly irritated but nothing bad. I did not apply any soothing after shave balm.<br /><br />The next day with minimal growth I shaved again, but this time I washed my face with liquid soap and reapplied a little soap and shaved with it. This went much more smoothly - so things are looking up.<br /><br />The shave I will use Dermologica Professional Shave, This stuff is a super slick clear lube that you apply just a drop or 2 to your wet face and it makes your skin slick as ice.<br /><br />I am thinking that Panasonic may have answered the shaving conundrum - will keep you posted.<br /><br />January 1, 2012 - I was wrong at least as it relates to my beard & face shaving with the Panasonic. After nine months and a set of fresh blades I sold the shaver and switched to the new Gillette 5 blade power system & their pro glide shave gel. I get an incredibly smoother shave and do it in half the time. I gave the Panasonic a fair chance but over all my face felt irritated and I could not get a clean shave.

  88. Shaving - I have had this product for 3-4 months now. I have only been using it as a wet shaver in my bathroom wash basin and I am very satisfied with the results. I have to make a few extra passes at the neck area - but other than that - excellent performance on rest of face. i have been using shaving foam and it helps reduce skin irritation considerably after shaves.<br />Oh, and it has no problems with longer stubble - like a 3-4 day growth (2 mm to 3 mm long). would possibly need to make a few extra passes to catch a few sneaky last ones here and there.<br /><br />Cleaning - i dont always use the cleaning station. Most times i just rinse the blades under the tap and leave the head open to dry. the cleaning base also has its own \\"drying\\" option. I use that a lot too. I have run the full clean+dry+charge cycle only 3-4 times (once a month) since i got the shaver.<br /><br />Overall - Good product - value for money. well built and good quality. bottomline - good shaving results. I must qualify that statement, though: I have not tried any other shavers by panasonic or competing brands - so I can not say it is the \\"best\\" shaver out there - but i'm quite impressed with it for a first shaver - it beats using 3/4/5 blade razors that cost $12-$15 for a 5-pck cartridge - Infact i am convinced that it delivers a much closer shave while being more comfortable and economical - so its a win / win / win every which way. happy shopping!<br /><br /> - - - - - -<br /><br />Writing back after over a year of using this product.<br />Still holding up pretty well. have'nt had any problems with it - holds charge for a long time still. Have not needed to change blades or anything. still get an amazingly close shave and covers the more tricky areas (neck / chin) just fine. Highly recommend. Never been satisfied with an electric shaver this much before. Changed my opinion about el. shavers for sure.<br /><br />Thank you Panasonic!

  106. I'm an older gentleman with a grey semi-heavy beard who has to shave everyday. I prefer a clean shaved face over any type beard, even a two day weekend stub. I'm on blood thinners so for years I had to give up shaving with a blade and use an electric razor for obvious reasons. My last shaver was the Braun 360, pretty much happy with it and I was going to purchase another one until I read the reviews on the Panasonic ES81095. Boy am I glad that I purchased the Panasonic over the Braun, there is no comparison to the shave quality not to mention the noise level being reduce and the overall cost. I like how the shaver fits your hand, your face contours and overall closness of shaving. In fact I look forward to using my new Panasonic every morning.
  107. I like this shaver works good. I use it on my face and use it for my head. It does a good job. Not as good as a razor but nothing beats razor IMO.
  108. I bought this as a gift for my husband 2 years ago. Amazon was having a special deal, so the product with the charger/cleaning system was only around $80. I don't think I would pay $180 for it, but I'd say it's worth at least $120. He uses it dry, but has also used it wet on occasion and it works equally well. Very nice, close shave, and still using the original blades. Doesn't change the cleaning cartridge until the light goes on--in contrast to the recommended changing which is much more frequent--and this seems to be working quite well. No noticeable reduction in performance or ability to hold charge and it has been used nearly every day for 2 years. At first I thought the cleaning system was a little over the top, as rinsing and tapping usually work just as well to clean out a razor, but I have to admit that the HydraClean system is really cool and seems to improve the blade life! It certainly has all the bells and whistles and makes for an excellent gift--I highly recommend this razor.
  109. My husband bleeds easily. After I spent 2 hours stopping the bleeding a couple of times I asked his doctor to ease up on the blood thinners. He told us to \\"get a better razer\\". We did. This is it and we cannot sing its praises highly enough.
  110. Gives a great close shave. I use it to shave my head. Fast and easy. Works great! Liked it so much, I bought my brother one!
  111. I've always been a Gillette razor user, but picked up this electric razor on an Amazon special just to give it a shot. Electric razors have come a long ways, last time I tried an electric Norelco and it wasn't anything to write about, it left my skin irritated and didn't come anywhere close to the shave this Panasonic gives. I've been using this razor every day for the past month, and it works great. It's nice that it can be used wet or dry, I typically use it in the shower and it does a pretty close shave not quite as good as the razor but you never nick yourself and your not having to change blades every couple weeks. The self-clean feature is also nice when I'm done with it I just drop it in it's base, and it's ready to go the next day.
  112. [[ASIN:B000VKZMHK Panasonic ES8109S Vortex Wet/Dry Shaver with Nano Technology and HydraClean System]] I suffer from Neuropathy and I could no longer use a regular safety razor without cutting myself. The Panisonic Vortex was perfect for me it gives a nice close shave wet or dry and the self-cleaning system works with little effort on my part. The price was right and I really feel I got good value for the money spent.
  113. I bought this razor to replace an existing electric razor. I am very pleased with it. It does a better job and I find myself not having to go over the same spot several times as I was doing with my old razor. It also indicates the battery charge so I know when to recharge. It may not be the best razor on the market but for the money it's hard to beat.
  114. I used to hate shaving! I used to use a razor and shaving gel, and used to get cuts and nicks all the time. I even developed dermatitis from time to time! This Panasonic shaver shaves very close to the skin, but it does not damage the skin. Also, the HydraClean System keeps the shaver very clean and hygienic. I have only used this product for a couple weeks, but I see visible difference in my skin condition. I also enjoy using this electric shaver wet (i.e., with shaving gel). It's very comfortable to shave with gel/cream. Not only do I get dermatitis anymore, I feel great after shaving. Another thing worth noting is its running cost. I used to pay about $5 per month for a pack of 4 razors. Now I only pay about $10 for 3 HydroClean cartridges, which last for over 3 months! You only need to replace the inner blades every two years (that's what the manufacturer recommends). A replacement only costs about $15~20.
  115. So I am replacing an older model of the Panasonic Wet/Dry variety and I am again satisfied. the battery inside wore out before the replacement blades did (I go through a normal razor in a week!) so this is definitely a solid 2-3 year purchase. My only gripe is that the ac adapter now is noticeably cheaper and makes a buzzing sound. I just space out my chargings cleanings a bit more.
  116. This razor cuts as good as any traditional razor. I was used to the rotary blade razors, but this Panasonic foil shaver surpassed any electric razor that I've ever used. I love the pivoting head that adjusts easily to the countours of my face.
  117. I used to use a Philips rotary shaver - all I can say is that this unit shaves much closer. I have very sesitive skin and there is virtually no razor burn. I can actually shave dry with this razor which is something I could never do with the Philips rotary. The one drawback is the it doesn't seem to do quite as good a job on my neck but still a much better job than the Philips (I guess you could say that for most razors). Make sure you buy an extra set of replacement blades. Overall a very good electric razor.
  118. Well this is my second Panasonic shaver. First one was a ES8066 and it lasted about 7 years or so. That was good enough for me. After all those years I needed a replacement and got ES8109S. I really like it. It is quiet, fast and gives you a close shave. The cleaning system's base unit is a little bulky especially if your space is limited in your bathroom counter and takes some work to prepare with solutions and so on. So I don't even use it. Also it seems that cleaning is not that much of a big deal if you're not shaving at the same time while you're taking a shower. I use my shaver dry and it is perfectly clean. Once in a while open the head of the unit and blowing on razor pieces a little does the job. For detailed cleaning I use the office supply cleaner air can used on the computers and so. I spray two short burst of air and that's good to go another month or two. Charge level indicator doesn't allow you to have a surprise power outage. Battery holds the charge long. Travel charger cord makes it possible to take it with you even for longer trips but generally one full charge is good at least 10 shaves. So if you're not climbing Everest for your next vacation and staying away from a power outlet more than 10 days this is a very good shaver.
  119. I used to use a rotary years ago, then switched back to the blade. Now I am happy after going back to electric. It took a while to get my routine down, but get a decent enough shave now. I kind of use a swirling motion, then horizontal strokes, followed by verticle movement. Different parts of my face obviously have different hairs requiring the varied directions. I shave dry while sitting in front of the tv or pc. I go by the sound of the head to judge how long or short the whiskers are. I try to dump out the thing, and only put it in the cleaner when the charge gets low for a tune up of the operation. I figured I had 30 days to try it and either keep it or send it back. It's a keeper.

The cleaning cycle took all night, but only wanted to offer the cleaning cycle after I had disconnected the power. I wanted to like this razor so badly because i had spent $100+ on it, but i couldnt take the splotchy rough shave. I tried it wet, dry, gels, creams, in the shower, nothing worked to improve the shave.

  129. Throughout my adult life I have alternated between electric and bladed razors. I love the speed and convenience of an electric razor, but love the closer shave of a bladed razor. It also seems that every electric razor I buy doesn't shave well for more than about a year, despite upkeep and blade/foil replacements. I've had Braums, Remingtons, Norelcos, etc., and at the price you pay for them they should last well beyond one year. But this was such a good deal that I decided to risk it again. Well so far I have been very pleased. Upkeep is minimal and it keeps a charge forever. Of course I am only shaving around a beard, but still it does well. I pretty much keep it in the shower and shave without soap, recharging/cleaning about once a week. Ergonomics are excellent, but time will tell if this beats the rest.
  130. I've used just about every shaver on the market. Remington's burn my face, Norelco's don't provide a close enough shave, and Braun's don't last and are too expensive. This shaver provides a close shave that is oddly enough incredibly similar to a blade. It's fun to use and even on the neck doesn't cause any irritation. The only draw back is that the power cord is not spiral so it takes up a lot of space.
  131. Okay, so, let me preface this buy saying that my Dad has been a thick, coarse bearded dude his entire adult life. Shaves everyday and has always used a traditional razor. The closer the better for him! After a heart attack he was put on many blood thinners and it was suggested that he no longer use a razor as he would probably not clot in the event that he nicked himself. Well, this news came to him as a huge problem and disappointment. He insists on a super clean, super close shave. He has tried MANY electric shavers over his 71 years.....none has ever made the cut (pun intended), not even close, always were a waste of money......until now! This one is a keeper-and not just because he has no choice. He actually loves it. Now, this doesn't shave quite as close as he can get with a traditional sharp razor but it truly does a fantastic job. He can use it wet or dry which was a great option before he left the hospital and in his first days home recovering. He could shave right from bed. Now that he is up and around again he uses it every morning and loves it. The dry shave option is nice later in the day as well if he has something to do in the evening (dinner out with Mom or something). He can touch up without the hassle of a wet face, razor, and shave cream....an option he did not have in the past. All in all it has worked out great! And we didn't expect it would no matter how well it worked. He looks good, looks clean shaven, and we've heard no complaints. I did buy replacement heads and parts etc., so he should be set for a while. I have read some reviews that say the self cleaning mode is somewhat noisy but honestly can't say that we have noticed that problem. Besides which you could just put it in cleaning mode on your way out if it seemed intrusive. We haven't had that problem though. I would recommend this razor to others!
  132. I purchased this razor less than one year after buying a Norelco (as a replacement for a good Norelco that gave up the ghost after nearly 10 years). The new Norelco had zero battery life and shaved poorly despite its cost of over $100. It has been nearly 30 years since I shaved with a foil razor and the technology has improved greatly. Panasonic razor works well; it cuts smoothly (closer than the Norelco) but it is particular about which way you draw the razor across your face. With the Norelco it did not seem to matter because of the circular blade action; with the Panasonic it is important to draw the razor against the direction in which my beard grows. This has taken a few times to \\"re-learn\\" how to shave but it is working well now. According to the manual the battery cannot be overcharged -- something that was a problem from the outset with the Norelco. I get about 8 shaves from a full charge right now -- I expect that to go up by a few over time as I get faster at shaving with this different type of razor. It cuts close but I had not had any skin irritation. Some areas take several passes -- not sure if that is me getting used to a new razor or a characteristic of the razor. It is finicky about the sides of my neck under my jawbones -- must go the right way there but it clears the beard after a couple of passes. The trimmer is not great -- if that is an important part for you, you might consider a separate appliance. It works OK for me but I only use it to trim sideburns. A caution: this is a noisy razor. Not objectionable to me but much louder than my Norelco. Overall, I like the shape, the moving head, and the closeness of the shave. It is comfortable in my hand and much like shaving with a big bladed conventional razor. Have not tried shaving wet or the cleaning station -- I just pop the foil head off and blow and brush the hairs out. I am very satisfied with the purchase and not sorry I switched.
  133. I am not sure if it is because I am not using it properly or what... But I do not always like the shave I get from this device. I never feel it's close or even enough! Again, it could be me not the device...?
  134. Shaver works super. In the shower or out, it's fine. My first electric razor in 25 years for whatever that's worth when checking this review. I've spent the last two months trying what I could, replenishing cartridges, using it daily, changing the water more often....... no success. I'm giving it 3 instead of 5 for just this reason. As the title says, the razor is fine, the cleaning system s**ks.

  143. Let me start by saying I have used Panasonic electric razors in past, like 10+ years ago. You can use dry or in the shower. I prefer the shower with shave gel, I have tried different combos but this is my favorite. I like the charging/cleaning stand too. You can save by not buying this but its a nice feature and Panasonic does not use an alcohol based cleaner so it lasts longer. Over all, I'm very happy with the performance of this razor. It holds a charge very well. I can get between 7 and 9 days per charge then place in in cradle and it cleans, dries and charges for me. I like the foil razors over the rotary blade shavers and this is a good buy for the $$. If you get 3yrs out of it its worth it in the long run plus it doesn't bother my skin at all. Buy it!!

  146. I bought this shaver for my fiancé for Christmas. He is an Italian, with course, thick facial hair that grows very fast. The man has a five-o'clock shadow by noon. He also has problem with razor burn and ingrown hairs on his neck. He had mentioned wanting to give an electric razor a try, so after a lot of research I bought the Panasonic. He is THRILLED. Having never used an electric razor, he was concerned that he would not get a close shave. Honestly, it's hard to tell that he didn't use his normal disposable manual razor. So, I figured I would try it for myself... I have always had a horrible time shaving my underarms. No matter what razor, shaving cream, or lotions I used I would end up with awful razor burn under my arms. And trust me, when you start sweating in the Florida weather and your underarms have razor burn, well, it's no good. When I used the honey's new razor I had NO razor burn, NO pulling, NO cuts, NO ingrown hairs. I love it! I've used it on my legs as well. It takes a little longer than the traditional route, but it's quite nice to be able to shave and watch TV at the same time. The cleaner is another added bonus. The upfront cost is a little pricey, but not when you factor in how much you would pay for disposable blades. This razor will quickly pay for itself. All in all, I would definitely recommend this product. I am thrilled, and so is my fiancé. The only problem is, now I think I may have to order me one as well!
  147. For me this shaver shaves better dry. I have tried it in the shower with and without shaving cream, and my face looks fine til I get out of the shower and notice several missed hairs, especially on my neck. It lists on here that it shaves in \\"1\\" pass, not so much.It takes 2-3 times as long to shave with this razor then it does with a standard razor. On the flip side, it does shave to the skin once I make several passes and I get far less razor burn and zero cuts with this Panasonic. I did get a smokin' deal on here though and shipping was fast. It should pay for itself quickly, considering I was paying out the rear for replacement Quattro blades for my Schick. I don't see how manufactures can charge around twenty bucks for a 4 pack of Quattro type blades for a standard razor. I was buying them off of Ebay for way cheap and way more. Then, a few weeks ago, I looked on Ebay to buy more Quattro blades and found no good deals, so I bought this Panasonic! After reading several reviews and seeing that most of you were rating this razor at 4-5 stars, I bought it! It does the job even though it takes longer then a standard razor, but will save you a lot of money in the long run!!

  157. This is, without a doubt, one of my worst purchases ever. Well, I've bought worse items before, but they're much cheaper. For $100 I expected so much more from the Vortex. I hate shaving and my wife hates stubble - not a good combination. With a blade I can only shave about once every 3 or 4 days because shaving short stubble for some reason really irritates my skin. I figured if I had a quality electric razor I could shave more frequently and my wife would be happier. Enter the Vortex. I've had it for about 3 weeks and have used it maybe 10 times. My beard doesn't grow fast, and it's not very thick so daily shaving isn't needed. I have tried shaving with this thing many different ways: bone dry, wet in the shower, in the shower with soap on my face, in the shower with regular shaving cream, with a shaving gel, and dry but with Afta pre-electric lotion. I also tried holding the razor at various angles, with varying pressures, and running it across my face at different speeds. I've pulled and stretched my skin out trying to get a close shave and it just doesn't happen. Weirdly enough, the best shave I've managed to get with this is shaving bone dry. Every time I use the razor I later find patches that just didn't get cut, so I have to go BACK to the bathroom to touch it up...and sometimes even then it doesn't shave closely. I probably spend at least 15 minutes solely on the shave which is ridiculous. With a blade it took no more than 10 minutes for a shower and a shave. Now I'm looking at at least 20, and the quality of the shave is absolutely pitiful. Considering the great reviews this gets I'm wondering if I have a faulty product, but I really don't think that's it. In the world of electric razors this might be one of the best, but why would you spend $100 for a product that eats up an outlet and counter space, and offers a worse shave than a $10 blade would offer? I gave this two stars because the areas that it does manage to cut are just as closely shaven as my razor (Gillette Fusion). I just have difficulty getting it to shave my entire face. *EDIT: March 18, 2011 The below comment, which I have no idea what the heck it's suppose to mean, has brought my attention back to this review so I'm giving an update. My above review was somewhat a rant, but I still feel it adequately reflects my feelings for this razor. I've been using it exclusively for several months and despite my best efforts it still gives a pretty bad shave. Before having an electric razor I shaved maybe twice a week with a blade. In order for this to do half-way decent I've found I need to shave at least once a day with this. The only benefit to that is that it doesn't take as long per shave if you use it more frequently. I bumped my rating up to three stars because I'm guessing it's designed to be used daily, not 2-3 times a week, so I'm rating it based on that now. The lone \\"pro\\" for this razor is that it's sideburn trimmer is great. It gives a nice, clean, close cut.
