  160. Worked great until the cleaner stopped draining after I replaced the cartridge the first time. The shave is very nice, but the cleaner is worthless. I have no idea what to do with this thing now. Before it stopped working, I would have given it 5 stars. Edit* I'm putting this back up to 5 stars because I got it working again. I guess anything that involves a drain and shave trimmings is going to get clogged once in a while. Just remember that if you buy this, you're eventually going to have to use a toothpick to unclog that drain.
  161. Over the years, I have tried a number of different electric shavers foils, rotary, and wet/dry. I would always return to a blade razor due to neck irritation and the lack of a close shave. I have a beard like wire and sensitive skin. This combination kept the styptic pencil people in business. Bleeding is even worse now due to medication. I had to do something about the nicking. So, I tried an electric one more time. This Panasonic razor gives me a close shave without the irritation experienced in the past. The closest shave and most comfortable occurs when wet using shave cream but using it dry is more than acceptable. Give it a try as it sure beats using a styptic pencil or that old stand by toilet paper. Maybe it is just me but did you all notice that your old style blade was not as sharp just prior to the introduction of a new more expensive blade.
  162. The Panasonic family is best for beards where the hair grows parallel to the face where the hairs lay down. The shavers also work great for normal perpendicular hair. The 8109 vibrates faster than the 8103 and battery lasts forever. The shave is identical between the two Panasonics (8103/8109) that I own. Had I known the differences were so slim, I would have gone ahead and bought new blades and screen for my 8103. The cleaner is nice and seems to keep the blades sharper. I have sensitive skin and have gotten the 'bumps' from Norelco style razors. The Panasonic is much less harsh on my skin. The hair on my neck really lays down and I must make several passes sometimes when I haven't shaved in a couple of days. Even with multiple passes the Panasonic does not irritate my skin. I would recommend the 8109S without worry. Just remember that blades and screen should be replaced yearly.
  163. I bought this for my husband. He comments every day about how much he loves it and has never had an electric shaver that worked so well. His face is baby's bottom smooth!
  164. I have pretty sensitive skin and have normally bought the 3 head shavers, mostly Norelcos. I didn't mind the Norelcos, but was at the point of needing new blades. Given the cost of the new blades and I had had the shaver for 3 years I decided to try something new and bought this razer.<br /><br />Pros - Nice, classy design. Give me a closer shave with less effort than what I've found with a tri-head shave. Recharging station works great and cleans the shaver perfectly every time. I sometimes don't clean the shaver for a few days and the cleaner works just as good then as when I do it daily. The LCD display works nicely showing the current charge level of the device. With shaving every other day the battery normally depletes to about 50-60% in a weeks period. Sits well in my hand as I use it. Whole system is simple to use including changing out cleaning fluid.<br /><br />Cons - Cleaning system and shaver are a bit loud. I was a little afraid of waking up the wife during either use but it hasn't been an issue yet.<br /><br />Overall good, product at a great price.
  165. It was a great buy! Works very good and it has been the closest shave I have ever had! The self cleaning is a plus
  166. I ordered this for my husband for Christmas but then found out he was looking online to buy one so I gave it to him early. He was overwhelmed by the programming features (he's not a detail person) but he quickly figured it out and plugged it in. To my surprise (and his) he absolutely loves it and has been using it ever since. He shaves both his face and head every morning and now he only uses this and he said it's better than he could have imagined! He is utterly amazed at the way this razor shaves his face and bumpy head! I am buying one for my legs!!!
  167. I was a devoted Braun user for the last 30 years. I bought a series 7 Braun which gave a close shave for the first year. The trimmer mechanism broke but was still usable. It ate up cleaning cartridges. It was as noisy as all hell. I thought about replace it but who need to spend another 200 buck. I tried a Panasonic Vortex for $79.00, with the cleaning station. It is quite, smooth, has a better cleaning station and the cartridges are cheaper and last longer. It can also be cleaned under running water with a little liquid soap. I will never go back to the overpriced Braun shavers. Good going for Panasonic.
  168. I decided to dump my conventional non-electric razor and try this electric shaver. I can understand it takes a few days to get used to a razor and that eventually razor burns go away. However, this electric shaver could not pick hair as cleanly at a regular gillette fusion blade. It's performance is inconsistent. I had to return the shaver. That said, the cleaning system is awesome.
  169. I got this after my very expensive name brand razor turned into what I would consider to be an epilator and not a shaver. I would actually fear shaving with it if I had missed a day. I pulled this out of the packaging and tried it out right away. I hadn't shaved in two days and the shave was great. It is very soft to the touch and has a high enough rpm motor that it doesn't slow down to cut hair like some other brands. It took just two passes on my scruffy face to clean it up. The wet/dry feature makes cleaning very easy. I really love the new panasonic lineup.
  170. I've had numerous shavers in the past,this is by the far the closest shave! It's also a very quick shaver doesn't take long at all to shave. Very smooth and very minimal skin irritation,that's saying a lot since I have sensitive skin. Does very well shaving on the jawline and under the chin. Easy to clean and the little screen lets you know the battery level,very cool! The cleaning/charging dock does very well on cleaning! You can charge it without the dock. If you shave every day it will last about 7 to 10 days. Would definitely recommend this shaver!
  171. This electric shaver is the best of the many I've had through the years. It is super fast, and doesn't pull or irritate my skin. It's easy to clean by holding under hot water from the facet, or by using the stand with a cleansing solution. I have owned electric shavers, including almost all brands, for over sixty years, and I recommend this one for its ease of use, being solidly built, and for doing as advertised.
  172. The ES8109S has really exceeded my expectations in every way. It is a beautiful piece of hardware, well balanced with perfect fit and finish. I have a very thick beard, and it shaves so close my face is like baby skin, and with no irritation. After using this for several weeks I've discovered a shaving method that really takes advantage of this wonderful machine. 1) Wash face, leave wet. Apply shaving cream (I use Edge Gel). 2) Turn on hot tap water. Turn on shaver, rinse in hot water while it's on, then start shaving 3) Periodically dip the (running) shaver under the hot water. The hot, wet blades melt the gel on your skin and help you to get a really close and comfortable shave. 4) Repeat step 3 until there's no more gel on your face, then give it one last good rinse before setting it in for a daily cleaning/charge. Your cleaning cartridges will last longer because the shaver is already pretty clean when you start the cycle. You will be rewarded with a pleasurable, close and comfortable shave that compares to going to the barber shop for a hot towel/straight razor professional shave. You will never get that with the \\"architec\\" or \\"pulsonic\\" shavers.
  173. I have had the shaver for little over a month now and I am not that impressed. The shaver never really gives me a close shave along the side of my face, but it will, however, around my lips...go figure. The battery life leaves a lot to be desired. I can't go more than 7-8 days and it needs a charge & cleaning. My last panasonic would last up to two weeks between charges & cleaning. Not a bad deal for the money. But I still expected more.
  174. Ive always used manual shavers. Got this as my first electric. I was worried about the closeness of the shave when I purchased it. But I cannot even tell a difference in the smoothness of my skin. The cleaning system works great and the trimmer is an extra bonus. Better than I could have hoped.
  175. I have had problems shaving since I hit puberty. My skin is extremely sensitive. Ingrown hairs and infections have become a mainstay in my life. The only product that worked was the Mach 3 razor...on its best day, it did not give me the best shave. Last week on a clinical rotation, I had one of the doctors look at my neck. \\"Sychosis barbae\\" is what he diagnosed. I was put on antibiotics to clear up this infection. That was my last straw. My roomate was so kind to let me use his Panasonic because the Mach 3 would have caused some serious damage. I have never had a shave like that in my life. I immediately ordered this model and have been a happy customer for 5 days. My infection has cleared up, and this shaver is nothing short of amazing. My facial hair grows in softer, and I am able to shave every day if need be (unlike every 2 to 3 days with the Mach 3). I would highly recommend this product to anybody. Having the HydraClean is great too. If you are on the fence about purchasing this shaver...buy it without hesitation!

I use an inexpensive electric pre-shave and that works just fine. I do not shave with this electric shave in the shower, but could if I wanted to do so.

  183. I bought this shaver a week ago and love it. I have a very tough, fast-growing (and increasingly grey) beard and this shaver does an excellent job. It is a replacement for a Braun 8585, which performed well, but was not as good as this one.<br /><br />As for the noise, this shaver is actually quieter than most electrics I've owned. I don't understand all of the negative comments about the noise at all. It has a higher pitch than my previous shavers, but that is not a problem. An electric shaver is going to make some noise, period.<br /><br />The cleaning mode works very well, and again it is quieter than any other self-cleaning shaver I've owned. The cartridges are less expensive than the Braun, as well (about 11 bucks with the subscribe-and-save program with Amazon), and they are less messy.<br /><br />The shape of this shaver is very different from the Brauns, but it took only a day or two to get used to it.<br /><br />My only real complaint is about the owner's manual. It was obviously translated by someone who's first language was definitely not English. I'm an engineer by trade, and I can make neither heads nor tails of the chart that explains the cleaning/drying/charging cycles. I just drop the shaver in the cleaner, press the selector button to get the right lights to come on, and I let it do its thing.<br /><br />Overall, I highly recommend this shaver. Panasonic is a great brand, and I expect a long life from this one.
  184. This is perhaps the best product of any kind that I have purchased in years! After numerous attempts to buy electra shavers manufactured by Remington (cheap, but should be labeled as a self-torture device for those that want to destroy their faces slowly and painfully) and Noelco (they work OK until it's time to clean them--then it takes a PHd in rocket science to put them back together again--I mean, they are AWFUL and to be avoided at all costs. And then I splurged on this Panasonic. I could not believe what I was feeling, what I was seeing, and how well this product is manufacture. It's the Mercedes-Benz or Porsche of shavers! First, it feels so good in the hand--built like a tank, stylish, and effortless to hold and manipulate. Having a heavy beard and sensitive skin, I took the advice of the directions and have used shaving cream every time (best wet/dry product I've ever used). It is incredibly comfortable. And then, what a great job it does! Not only as good as using a blade, but much better and more consistent. Shaving has gone from a chore to a genuine pleasure. I can't rave about this product enough. It is so much better than anything I tried under $125 that is belongs in a class by itself. Buying anything else is a mistake.

  189. I've tried them all. I've tried electric shavers that were half this price, and I've tried electric shavers that were more than double this price. I've gone with the top of the line Braun's, Philips Norelco's, and Remington's. I had to return all of them. For an electric shaver, this model was the best by far. It's easy to use and easy to clean (with the cleaning solution OR with soap and water). I love how it can be used dry (my usual method) or wet as well (in the shower if I'm in a hurry). I love how the charge lasts for days if I'm traveling. I love how it's fun to use. And most importantly, I love (and my girlfriend especially loves), how smooth my face feels after using it. I had used regular razors for years before deciding to give electrics a try. The decision was mostly based on the fact that I hated how time consuming a task I found shaving to be. The only razors that I found got close enough to my skin, had expensive cartridges that needed to be replaced way too often because of how fast my thick stubble dulled them. Eventually, I just kind of stopped shaving regularly. I didn't necessarily like keeping a beard, but I disliked shaving even more, so I just stopped. After a while, when I noticed people started assuming I was about ten years older than I actually am, I decided I better start shaving again. And so this time, I decided to try the electric route. After going through the gauntlet with pretty much every other high and low end electric shaver out there, I decided to try this Panasonic (a decision I made from reading these reviews on Amazon actually). That was a great decision. Immediately, I noticed the difference between this and all the other razors I tried. It seems that 13,000 RPMs does apparently make a difference. It gave me a cleaner, faster shave than any of the others. I don't know why exactly, maybe it was simply because I feel that it actually works, but I even have \\"fun\\" using it. As far as how well itworks. On my face, it definitely gives the closest shaves I've ever had. It hands-down beats every electric shaver AND regular razor that I've ever used. On the neck however, it does seem to continually miss some spots, and just can't quite adapt to the topography of my Adam's apple. It's not too bad, but on days that I have important meetings/interviews, I do have to go over my neck with a regular razor just to make sure everything is perfect. These instances are few and far in between, and for everyday use though, this is the tool to shave with.

  193. I have been shaving with a blade for over 30 years and have not had much experience with electric shavers. I must say that I am quite pleased with the results. Best results so far are using it wet with a gel-type shaving cream.
  194. A solid shaver, in continus competition with my [[ASIN:B003YJAZZ4 Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Silver]] for my favorite electric.<br /><br />This is the closet electric shave I have found so far. I have used this, the above mentioned Braun, and the [[ASIN:B003V37ZDS Philips Norelco 1250x/40 SensoTouch 3d Electric Shaver, Black]]. In fact, if you press to hard and shave too fast, you can get very small cuts (relatively harmless, but they do bleed). Proper technique avoids this problem - just go slow and trim your beard before you shave.<br /><br />Shave quality: Just about on par with the Braun, which is very, very good. As mentioned, this is the closest shave currently available (February 2012). The Braun does provide a head that does seem to catch more hairs easily, but the sharpness of these blades, and the closeness of the shave, just about make it even in terms of shave time and hairs cut. The Panasonic also allows wet shaving, which cannot be understated (see below).<br /><br />Ergonomics: The best of the breed. the most comfortable to hold of any of the above mentioned shavers. Sculpted to fit either hand. The shave heads are angled perfectly. Notches on the side provide a solid grip, and a patterned thumb dot on top provides a comfortable place for said digit to rest.<br /><br />Wet/Dry mode: If you are a lifelong electric user, wet shaving will open your eyes. You can take this shaver in the shower with no problem, and you can use any shaving cream or foam you'd like - the Panasonic cuts right through them. Shaving in the shower softens your beard, and creams really lubricated and soften the blow of scraping steel across your face. This is an awesome feature and one you will (or should) use often.<br /><br />Trimmer: The integrated trimmer is the best I have seen - it is stronger than the Braun and Norelco and also very well positioned to easily reach your face. However, it will not replace a stand alone trimmer - this will only work for a day or two of stubble (depending on your beard hairs thickness).<br /><br />I suggest throwing away the charging base. It charges it perfectly, but the Vortex cleaning system is a bit messy (I have had it leak) and smells a but sticky and cheap. You can super easily clean this in the shower or under the faucet, however - just pull off the top foil and run it under running water. This is the easiest shaver to clean.<br /><br />Pros:<br />Super close shave<br />Ergonomic design<br />Wet/dry capability - can be used in the shower and with shaving cream<br />Very easy to clean<br />Well priced<br />Strong trimmer, and well angled to reach your face - though you will still need a stand-alone<br /><br />Cons:<br />Vortex cleaning system leaks a bit, and is sticky, not the best scent

  198. I bought this to replace my aging Braun 8500 series razor, which performed consistently well but managed to destroy its foils every 2-3 months recently. After the third foil cost me about half a new razor, I decided enough was enough and sprung for the Panasonic. The razor itself is fantastic - close shave, very reasonable noise level, waterproof head assembly, easy to clean, etc. The battery life isn't quite as good as I'd like, but it's good enough for 1.5 weeks on the road. Unfortunately, the base isn't up to spec - the clean cycle simply doesn't do a very good job and the controls for selecting what you want the base to do are downright bad. I'd buy the razor by itself instead of getting the base with it - just clean it yourself with some warm water and rubbing alcohol.

  201. I thought the Gillette MACH Fusion Power ad of $1 a week as too much, so I bought this for $69 at Circuit City days, just before they went out of biz. I only shave once a week to every three days. My skin has gotten use to the shaver in about two months, but I still get some cuts around my neck and throat. After shaving with razors for a decade and a half, and going with the shaver, I found some things counterproductive and breaking basic shaving rules. I first go over the face and neck with the shaver. My chin and neck normally need retouching, so I use cold water to clean out the shaver. Strange huh? Then I still have some stragglers in those areas. I end up using the machine up,down, down up, to left, right, right left. I never did that with a razor; downward strikes only, every 1/4-1/2 of an inch was my routine. After about five minutes, the shave does not look bad. I still use a balm after it is all done. Maybe $1 a week is not too much after all. I am not sure that I can continue using this after 69 weeks to save money.

  222. I have owned electric shavers for the past 20 years. I prefer the wet/dry ones and have owned Panasonics and Norelcos. I would occasionally switch back to a blade because I couldn't find an electric that even came close to a blade but I would always switch back to an electric for the convenience. My last Norelco Advantage died last week after 7 years of use. It never quite gave a great shave but I liked the fact that it could use lotion and be used in the shower. After looking at the reviews on Amazon, I ordered the Panasonic ES8109S. After using it for one day, I can tell you that it shaves as close as a blade. I couldn't believe it and the fact that I can use shaving cream is great. It feels very solidly built and I like the lcd screen that tells you the charge level. Not a complaint but just a word of caution. This thing is alot louder than my norelco Advantage. I get up earlier than my wife and if I didn't use a separate bathroom, I can guarantee that she would wake up after I start it up. If you are use to a foil razor, it may not be much louder but compared to a round bladed razor, it is a wake up call. The cleaning/charging station feels very solid as well and the cleaning/dry cycle is not really that loud. The fan in the dry cycle is actually very quiet. The cleaning uses a detergent cartridge with water from the tap instead of an alcohol solution. One cartridge will last for 30 cleanings. Amazon sells them in a 3 pack for about $11. Overall, I would highly recommend this razor. Panasonic got it right with this one.
  223. I got this for hubby and he can not stop talking about it! He loves it. He said he has never got a closer shave even with a blade. And no nicks at all. We are very pleased with this product.
  224. Bought the shaver after reading the reviews not impressed at all. It takes a lot longer to shave compared to my older phillips shaver with 3 circular heads. Shave is not as smooth as the phillips one. Not worth the money
  225. I have had this shaver for about a month now and am pleased with the closeness of the shave. Also the shaver lasts about 5 days on a single charge. The cleaner doesn't use any irritating alcohol to clean the shaver just soap and water. No complaints so far.
  226. I am a recent convert from Gillette Mach 3, which i have been using for over a decade. I never believed that any electric shaver would come close to the comfort and closeness of using a blade, since i have a very thick and extensive beard growth. For the same reason dry shaving never worked for me. My problem with blades was that i always ended up getting a 5'O Clock shadow. Hesitantly i decided to try this Panasonic shaver after reading the reviews here - WOW !! what a difference! I still use lather/foam to shave with this shaver and the shave is so close that the 5 O clock shadow always shows up late :) by as much as a whole day !<br /><br />This shaver has given me the closest shave \\"ever\\" and my face feels so smooth even when feeling against the grain. Very highly recommended to all who are hesitant to move from blades to electric. I would highly recommend use of lather for the closest possible shave.<br /><br />EDIT: After 3 months of daily use, i feel that i dont get a shave as smooth as i initially got when the blades on this were new - i have an extensive growth, and always shave wet with lather. Even though, the shave is still better than what i used to get shaving with Mach 3 - just not as good as the first month of shaving - i am thinking i will try putting a new blade - that may help - but then this will be a more expensive a proposition to use as a blade system.
  227. Razor is fast, gives a close shave. It holds a charge for a hold week of shaves. The HydraClean System does an excellent job of cleaning. I have averaged using the clean system once a week. Would recommend this razor to the person who wants a close shave, but don't have time to waste!
  228. I chose to buy this shaver after reading a lot of online reviews and receiving a discount program with Panasonic. Initially i was excited about the shaver and its advanced technologies, but when i received the shaver, i was actually a little bit disappointed. Personally, i desire a shaver that's comfortable, thorough, and fast (as in completing a shave). This shaver only covers the comfort part for me. My facial hair grows rather quickly in various places on my face (i'm not a caveman but i would consider myself hairy for a young Asian male). I used to have a Phillips/Noreco shaver and it got the shaving done quick and thorough, although it wasn't nearly as comfortable as this Panasonic shaver. The fancy technologies on this shaver are all cool and useful but I would have to shave the same area on my face for about 4-5 times to get a complete shave (keep in mind electronic shavers aren't as thorough as regular shavers). I wouldn't have spent $120+ on this if I had tried it out in a store first. On a side note, NEVER order from Panasonic website direct, because they are incompetent and they even charged me an item that i didn't order on my credit card. How crazy is that?
  229. This is the second Panasonic shaver I have owned. This one is far superior to the previous one. The shave is extremely close. I really like the cleaning system that comes with this shaver. I just rinse it off when I am done, put it in the charger/cleaner and it is ready to go when I need my next shave. A couple of notes. If you have not used an electric shaver before or in awhile it will take your face awhile to get use to it. I have also found that this shaver shaves so close I wash my face AFTER shaving to make sure I don't get any ingrown hairs. Might sound silly but this shave is that close. I also reccomend that you don't use shave cream with this shaver. I use Williams Lectric shave before shaving. I found it difficult to get the shaver really clean when using a shave cream. One great feature is that you dont have to use the cleaner if you don't want to or can't. An example would be if you are on vacation. Just rinse it off when you are done!
  230. My wife bought this razor for me for my birthday. I've used it for about 3 months now and I love it. I am in the military and close shaves are a must. Unfortunately, I have very dark and coarse facial hair, and electrics have never cut it well (especially the neck!). I used to use a Mach 3 because that was the only was to get a decent shave. I got tired of the constant nicks, cuts and razor burn, so I was on the lookout for an electric. I looked at the top-of-the-line models from Braun and Norelco before I came across this razor. Thank goodness! The price is excellent for the quality of the razor. Plus, you get the cleaning system which is very nice as well. The best feature of this razor is the wet/dry capability. I use it in the shower with shave gel and get nearly as close a shave as I would with a blade with NONE of the irritation. It does a decent job dry as well. I am extrememly pleased with this product.
  231. Since the 1950s, I've used several different brands and models of electric shavers in addition to blade razors. As far as I'm concerned, the Panasonic ES8109S Vortex is the best of the lot. Although I haven't yet had the occasion to use the wet shave feature, I feel that the shaver will perform very well when used in that mode. This is the only electric shaver that I've used that gives me a shave as close as my blade razors have. I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.
  232. EDIT:<br />Before, I gave this product five stars, but since then it has proven to be less-than-durable and become unreliable and started to give my skin bumps and irritation. The thing that locks the cover over the blades became loose and sometimes the cover would pop off in the middle of shaving, and other times it literally cut me!<br /><br />I have since switched back to a regular razor.
  233. After a week, I have to say, I'm convinced the positive reviews of this product are spot on. This product performs it's job very well. It provides a very close and comfortable shave. I admit I have not taken it to the shower yet. (I'm concerned about dropping when wet) Even if it doesn't work as well wet, this unit is one I can recommend 100%.

That's ridiculous and impractical, so now I have to pay an extra $30 for a replacement charger which should have been covered under warranty.

  237. When I buy something I want the best I can afford. You'd think that was normal, but a lot of people seem unable to *shop* and just buy whatever's convenient. The Net makes pretty much everything easy to buy so why not do your research and spend money wisely? That's why I love Amazon reviews. Rather than hit every good and bad point about this product I'm going to give some info on me and why I bought it so people in similar circumstances can get an idea of whether it'd be good for them. I can't compare it to others in this price range because I haven't tried them. In the past I've used Braun and Remington electric razors (cheap ones in the $25-$35 range) but have mainly used blades, in recent years the rather effective Mach3. But children shouldn't be allowed in the men's grooming section at stores since I want to curse like a sailor every time I buy refill blades! Plus to put it as simply as possible, I have bad skin. I had bad acne as a teenager and its been back again in recent years though at least slightly better. So between treatments and bad genes my face is usually broken out to some extent and alternately greasy or dry. And the skin is always sensitive. Regardless of razor, shaving cream/gel, technique, or schedule the irritation of shaving just made things worse. And I always got cuts and red marks on my neck. I wanted to try an electric razor again and in making an effort to solve my problems I read almost all the reviews on Amazon. They all started to run together and I was prepared to spend $200+ if it was going to get the job done. But after reading I didn't think $200 was going to get me any more than $100. This is a wet/dry razor which I hadn't really thought about. It looked to be the only well rated one around $100 which was probably because its not Panasonic's most recent model. It really does work pretty good. I'd say the shave is very nearly if not as close as I've been able to get with a blade. I did not seea big improvement from the first day to the 30 days later they tell you to get used to the razor. But its working well so that's fine. I don't use it in the shower since I'd be sure to lose a sideburn without a mirror. I do rinse it frequently while shaving and will use it slightly wet to get a stubborn spot. Its comfortable to hold and seems well-built. The size of the head makes the trimmer harder to see then my old electrics but I don't use it that often. I wanted a charging/cleaning station but haven't really been able to tell if the cleaning makes much of a difference. I thought people that complained about the noise were overreacting, but the cleaning cycle is noisy. I set it to run just before I leave for work. Its also got a noticeable hum when charging so I occasionally unplug it but it charges fast enough that its usually always at 100% anyway. My face is definitely less irritated than with a blade. I'd definitely recommend this razor and didn't give it 5 stars simply because I couldn't compare it with others to be sure it absolutely deserved a top rating.
  238. Have had this since xmas and so far, it is a great shaver. Wet or dry it does a great job. The only problem when in the shower is not being able to see what your doing. Be sure to get a fogless mirror so you can see. Very close shave wet or dry
  239. Started shaving my had last week! Upon reviewing several brands and head shaving sites, I decided that Panasonic was the shaver for me. This shaver works great - it maintains the 13,000rpms and I get a closer shave than with a blade on my head. Perfect for the job.

  249. This is my third electric shaver in eight years. My first was a Braun Syncro 7526 (with a cleaning stand), which I bought back in January of 2001. The second is a Norelco 7885XL, bought in January of 2004. I wrote a review of both those electric shavers here at Amazon. Both of them are still working. The Braun has had its set of foil and cutter replaced a few times over the years. Basically, I replace my shavers after four years of daily use to upgrade to newer technology. My newest electric shaver, the Panasonic ES8109S, is the subject of this review.<br /><br />This Panasonic is a versatile shaver. Unlike my previous electric razors, this one can be used \\"wet\\". Basically, you can use it with your shaving cream, just like a regular blade razor. And like a typical electric razor, you can use it dry. You can clean it with soap and water, or you can use the cleaning stand. The 8109S gives you choices.<br /><br />Ok, you're thinking, \\"This Citan has been using an electric razor for eight years. I'll buy whatever he recommends. He's the new electric razor guru, the next best thing to God. A Stud among us!\\". Now, I appreciate your vote of confidence, but I am no electric razor guru. And definitely not a God. Stud maybe . . .<br /><br />So, what has been the closest shave of the past eight years? There was a period of about 4-5 months during those eight years when I took a break from the electric razor and tried a Gillette Mach 3. I started with the typical shaving gel and found that the Mach 3 shave was only marginally smoother than the Braun Syncro's. Eventually, I decided to try using a shaving brush and a shaving soap with the Mach 3. And that my friends, gave me the best shave of my life! However, it was also messy and probably wasteful of hot water. Not to mention the fact that the replacement blades for the Mach 3 were somewhat expensive. You see, to get the best (and most comfortable!) shave out of a blade razor, you have to replace the blade often. Once a week, in my case. Once you feel the razor tugging, it's time for a new blade. So, I went back to the electric razor and have not looked back since. And no, I do not have the courage to try a straight razor!<br /><br />This Panasonic shaves better than the old Braun and the old Norelco. It is the most comfortable of the three. Perhaps because the ultra-fast blades lessen the chances of the razor tugging on your beard. The beard gets sheared off before the razor can move. Hence, you will not even feel the slightest pull. I wanted to try how the Panasonic will perform when used with a shaving soap. Using a shaving brush, I whipped up some foam on a mug, wet my face with hot water, and lathered it on. Under those conditions, the Panasonic gave me the best shave that I can remember. In fact, I now shave at night, before bed. The shave is so good that my face is smooth all throughout the next work day.<br /><br />Now, does it make sense to use a shaving brush and a shaving soap with an electric razor? Probably not, as that defeats the need for convenience. Citan would be late for work if he did this in the mornings!. I will most likely go back to dry shaving very soon. But I just wanted to see the potential of the Panasonic.<br /><br />How does it shave dry? Very good. The best of any electric shaver that I have tried. But you will have to try it for yourself. The ergonomics are fine for me. If you have a prominent Adam's apple, you may be better off with a blade razor. The larger heads of the electric razors might make it hard to maneuver around your Adam's apple.<br /><br />The cleaning stand is terrific! The razor comes out clean and recharged. It also leaves an oily film on the foil for lubrication. While the razor can be cleaned with tap water and soap, I really do recommend the use of the cleaning stand. The cutters on this Panasonic oscillates very fast, against the foil. I am not an engineer, but I suspect the Panasonic has a greater need for lubrication than most other foil razors due to its faster speed.<br /><br />My face did not require any adjustment time to get used to this shaver. I went from a Norelco 7885XL (rotary type) to this Panasonic with no issues whatsoever. Maybe your experience will be different. I have visited many shaving forums and message boards over the years. And there are some people who will always have trouble shaving, no matter the system they choose. I hope you're not one of those.<br /><br />I recommend this shaving system to anyone who wants to try a new electric razor. The Panasonic wet-dry shavers are very versatile.er foil razors due to its faster speed. My face did not require any adjustment time to get used to this shaver. I went from a Norelco 7885XL (rotary type) to this Panasonic with no issues whatsoever. Maybe your experience will be different. I have visited many shaving forums and message boards over the years. And there are some people who will always have trouble shaving, no matter the system they choose. I hope you're not one of those. I recommend this shaving system to anyone who wants to try a new electric razor. The Panasonic wet-dry shavers are very versatile.
  250. So I was totally stoked on this product when I ordered it. I have wanted a wet/dry electric for a long time and had been using a basic Braun model before. Upon the first time I used the Vortex, I felt like I was using a shaver I had already been using for six months. I literally have to go over my face in all directions multiple times to get a clean shave and still this thing misses a decent amount of hair. If it works like my Braun that has a year old blade does, then I will be unsatisfied. I would have kept the Braun had the automatic cleaner part of it not broken.

My biggest peeve is that it doesn't seem to last. I hate hair on my upper lip. When I use this, it's usually grown in by the end of the day and I'm not some hairy sasquatch.   262. I have used a lot of shavers over the years. All of them have been wet/dry, because shaving with a wet beard gives a much closer shave. And almost all of them have been Panasonic, because they carry a broad line of wet/dry shavers. I have been satisfied with all of them, but buying this Vortex was the first time that purchase price was not my primary consideration. And I can honestly say that this is by far the best shaver that I have ever used. First, even when I have skipped a couple of days of of shaving, and my beard is really rough, this shaver does its job smoothly, quietly, and effortlessly. And it gives a great shave every time. It also has some bells and whistles, like a digital readout of the remaining battery life, so you never have to worry about your shaver quitting on you in the middle of the job. And the Vortex's cleaning system allows you to easily clean your shaver and make sure that it stays that way. I haven't owned it very long, but I am hoping that using this system regularly will prolong its life. Here's the bottom line: sometimes it is worth paying more money than you are accustomed to, and this is definitely one of those times.

  269. I replaced my old Norelco circular-blade razor with this one from Panasonic. If you're used to the circular blades, this razor is going to require some adjustment to your routine because it won't cut any hairs growing perpendicular to the direction of the blades. Shaving the neck becomes a slow process as you must pull the skin tight and hold the razor at a variety of angles in order to get it all. The self-cleaning system is definitely worth it -- very convenient and doesn't clog often, although you really do have to replace the cleaning carterage every month.

  272. I bought my last Panasonic razor 15 years ago, and it worked well for all that time. But I decided it was time to replace it and bought what I thought would be the latest upgrade. I did not actually want the HydraClean feature--I think that's mostly a gimmick to get you to continuously buy the associated replacement parts, and in any case I was able to clean my last razor simply by using the little brush that came with it. I just wanted a new, and potentially better, version of what I already had. This unfortunately isn't it. The shave is almost as good but not quite. It also has an annoying indicator light that flashes frantically when it is fully charged, as though I should be excited about that information and take some action. Note to manufacturers: It's great to have an indicator light to tell you something is charging, or that it is fully charged, or that there is some kind of problem that requires an action. But, particularly with regard to charging, there is absolutely no reason to have it flash, and since people typically leave their razor in the bathroom, where they may need to go in the middle of the night, a flashing light is actually an annoyance as it tends to wake one up. Overall, this is still a perfectly adequate razor and I will be using it for the next fifteen years in all likelihood. I will probably just break the indicator light. Although they don't tell you this anywhere, you can just ignore the HydraClean thing, as I plan to. I will say that the shaver fits very nicely into one's hand, and being a Panasonic, will probably be fairly trouble-free.
  273. Battery lasted just long enough for the guarantee period to run out. Stopped using these a few years ago. Went back to multiple blade razors and have been a lot happier.
  274. [[ASIN:B000VKZMHK Panasonic ES8109S Vortex Wet/Dry Shaver with Nano Technology and HydraClean System]] For it's price, this shaver is a bargin and a half. Change the cleaning solution monthly, using purified water, not tap, and this shaver will provide months and months of smooth, close shaves.
  275. Smooth quick shave. I need to find a cheaper cleaning cartridge though[[ASIN:B000VKZMHK Panasonic ES8109S Vortex Wet/Dry Shaver with Nano Technology and HydraClean System]]
  276. I have to use an electric unless I want to see blood. Closest shave I've ever had with an electric. Easiest way for me to tell is at the end of the workday, less 5 o'clock shadow. My beard is tough, medium density; it grows rapidly and it's grey so less is better and it is noticeably less with this shaver. I wouldn't hesitate to go to a business diner without a second shave after using this, not the case with the brand X I tossed after using the Panasonic. I wanted to try a shaver with a \\"cleaning system.\\" An electric razor is useless after about a week unless it's disassembled and thoroughly cleaned. Takes 15 - 20 minutes to do it right and it's nuisance. But I refuse to pay $200 to $300 for an electric razor when I know the battery will die in a year or so. I typically pay $60 for an electric razor but the reviews on this and Panasonic's reputation prompted me to go \\"upscale.\\" Good decision. Pros: Close shave, nice battery state indicator, relatively quiet, trimmer only runs when it's in the up position, center blades knock down the long stuff. Rinses out so cleanly with just the faucet, I'm not sure it really needs the cleaning system but that works well too. The floating head is probably nice for some people: I don't care for it so it has a locking feature to disable the float. I get a minimum of 10 days between charges. Optionally recharges with just the cord; good for extended travel. Cons: takes just a little longer to get a close shave and works better if I move the shaver slowly over stretched skin. Cleaning system is a little bulky so you wouldn't travel with it but as above, I'm not sure it's needed. I actually keep the cleaning system in my workshop and only the razor in the bathroom. I'm sure it works if you want to shave in the shower; where I live the cost of water would make that a luxury I don't chose to afford so haven't tried that. Update: after seven months, I bought a second one for travel, makes sense for me. ANDI discarded the Panasonic cleaning system. It tends to leave the shaver with an unpleasant smell and the second unit came with an insert that recommended just a drop of dishwashing soap inside the head, put the head back on and run it briefly in turbo mode and rinse. Takes maybe 15 seconds and it's clean and fresh. Easier, cheaper, faster and less bulky than the factory cleaning system.
  277. My last electric shaver was a braun shaver that I purchased refurbished about 5 years ago. That worked well enough for every day shaves, but once I replaced the foil a few times, I decided to return to razor shaving. Fast forward to a few weeks ago, I purchased this shaver based on the high reviews on Amazon. Bottom line, this thing stinks. It doesn't shave closely, leaves patches despite multiple run throughs, and where it does shave closely (neck area) it inflames the skin and becomes uncomfortable for the rest of the morning. I don't have particularly sensitive skin. I purchased lectric shave and even followed the advice of some users to take a hot shower, apply the alcohol based solution to my skin, and then shave. It ran smoother against my skin, but the results remained the same. I'm left with a $100 paperweight. I think I'm going to buy a new foil for my 7 year old braun and just start using that again. This is a pathetic shaver.
  278. Wow!- I've never used an electric razor before, and this product has got me off of blades forever, I think. I've only had it a couple of weeks, but each time I take a shave in the shower (without a mirror), I'm amazed at how close a shave I get. It takes a little time to get it just right, but I'm in the shower and don't mind having the water pouring over me as I get my shave on. The cleaner is pretty cool too, although it takes an hour to do the job. I'm O.K. with that- I don't anticipate needing to shave for at least another twenty four hours. Sometimes there are a few errant hairs on my neck; that's the toughest place to shave for me, but no razor burn and a baby smooth face- I really can't complain.
  279. I've had many electric razors before. This one does a very average job, at best, providing a close shave. It takes me many swipes in different directions to shave an area acceptably. It's a bit disappointing. You can get the same quality of shave in many cheaper razors.<br /><br />Also, the cleaning tank of this unit is very gimmicky and I don't use it at all. The thing stays on a long time unnecessarily and I don't believe it really does much cleaning of the head at all.<br /><br />Better to just run water over the head from the faucet, dry it with a towel and call it a day.<br /><br />The only really good thing I can say is its charger works well and the razor holds a long charge, but considering one needs to stroke an area many times to shave it in the first place, the razor needs the extra charge life - lol.<br /><br />This razor considering its price, the uselessness of the cleaning tank and its shaving ability.....<br /><br />2 stars and I'm being generous.
  280. I have owned my first and last Panasonic shaver. After only six months the recharger completely failed, remaining filled with water with the operating lights going out permanently. The \\"service\\" department requires that you send in the whole system for a remedy, and hangs up on you when you question the wisdom of that course of action. I would not recommend this product at all and only gave it one star because this review system requires it.
  281. i used this shaver for almost 2 months, twice as long as panasonic recommended for your face to \\"get used to it.\\" does a decent job on the face, routinely misses neck hairs, leaves stray hairs on the neck. not a good shaver, back to the blade for this face.
  282. Totally worth the price of the product, I mean if you add up how much it will cost you to use disposable razors or whatever you use you will realize that this price equals out to about the same cost as a years worth of disposable razors. This product is eco friendly because you don't have to keep throwing razors in the trash and wasting plastic etc. I would however NOT recommend using it in the shower. The reason for this is because no product ever will be good to use in a vast amount of water. All products will get corrosion and it's impossible to say it wont. I never use it in my shower and never will because you will have to replace it after at least 6 months, not because its made poorly because its not made poorly but because it is electronic. Purchase this product and never feel the need to touch a disposable razor again!!
  283. Excellent overall shaver -- works very well as a wet shaver in the shower. I used a Braun (the model in the cradle that cleans itself) for many years and liked it as well, but I like this Panasonic better -- and I like its smaller cradle and cleaning mechanism better.
  284. I've tried numerous electric shavers, including the really excellent high end Braun shavers. My guess is that different shavers will suit different beards/faces, and for some the Braun may be best. The bottom line is that this shaver is the closest shave I've ever had with an electric shaver - meaningfully closer on my face than even the Bruan. The Braun is an extremely high quality machine, shaves very fast, the battery is amazing, and the trimmer is better than on this one, but the Panasonic beats it for closest shave (on my beard), and really cuts as close as a manual razor, but without the nicks and irritation of a manual shave. Highly recommended.
  285. I finally got tired of messing around with safety razors and splurged on an electric razor. I am VERY pleased with both the shave quality and LOVE the automatic cleaning function with this razor. I couldn't be any happier with my purchase.
  286. So I have always been skeptical of electric razors. I have owned the a couple Norelcos including their \\"top of the line\\" [[ASIN:B000PKKAGO Philips Norelco arcitec 1090 Men's Shaving System]] and always found them lacking. They would leave a lot of hair still on my face. So I switched over to a [[ASIN:B000NL0T1G Merkur Model 180 Long Handled Safety Razor]] and it is great but shaving with it takes a while because you have to be careful not to cut yourself. I needed a quick razor to get most of the hair before I had to head out to work. Enter the Panasonic ES8109S. After reading the reviews I figured $100 wasn't a bad price for supposedly such a good razor (and cleaning system). Turns out the reviews are true. This thing is amazing. It cuts really close (even when dry it is comparable to a disposable manual razor) and is much quicker than my safety razor (though I will probably still use my Merkur on weekends when I have more time). I would definitely suggest this to anyone thinking about an electric razor. Also, one of the other reviews said it was really loud but I don't find it much louded than any other electric that I have used. I wouldn't think people in another room would be bothered by it. I have only had this razor for a couple of days, so I will update my review as time passes and try more of the functions.
  287. I have owned Braun shavers for years and have been very happy with them. When it was time to replace my old shaver I wanted to try something that did not require ongoing purchases of cleaning cartridges which were adding up with the Braun after several years. So I tried a rotary and hated it, within 3 months I was looking for something better. I had always thought of trying the Panasonic as they're products are usually pretty good from my experience. This shaver is no exception, it is the best shaver I have owned. Being able to use it wet is a great feature - the shave is very close and does not irritate your skin. The price for the Panasonic has always been fairly high but this is a great deal and well worth it. the cartridges are not cheap but they seem to last a long time because they are not alcohol based. The cartridges contain a soap that mixes with water you put into another canister. I run the clean cycle after every use and the first cartridge is still in use after a month or so. I do pre-rinse after every use before putting it in the cleaner. Battery life is pretty good. I have not travelled with it yet but expect you could get at least 5 days of use without a recharge probably 7 or 8 days.
  288. I have tried to use an electric shaver many times over the years but have never really been satisfied with the shave. I ordered this and did not shave for 5 days until I received it. After the shave, it feels like I would say 6-8 hours after a shave with a blade. With a blade, going up against the beard leaves no noise with rubbing your hand against your face. After using this unit, I still have that tiny feeling of hair, and the noise. I think this unit is good for someone who needs to shave everyday. I usually shave 3 times per week on average. I am debating on keeping the unit.

  292. First a liitle background, I haven't used an electric shaver in 10 years and always shaved with a razor. The only drawbacks I have encountered is being that my wife and I are on opposite schedules it seems a little on the loud side and forget about using the cleaning mode if you want to keep it quiet. It seems to take a long time and is very noisy as it goes through its cycles, but i don't clean it all the time and just wait until everyone is up or out of the house when I do use that mode. Last but not least, neck hairs seem to be a problem for it requiring mulitple passes. if it was a little quieter and didn't need so many passes over the same problem areas I would give it 5 stars because it really does shave close.

  295. It is cordless and the battery works just fine. It has a cleaning mechanism that is only about twice as bothersome as cleaning the razor by hand. Speaking of the cutters and the screens, they become quite warm before I am finished shaving which leads me to believe that there is friction and that the very thin screens are not likely to last very long. For this reason I decided to buy replacement screens, but in Amazon's many pages of Panasonic razor stuff I find screens for dozens of different razors, but alas, none for this model. This is annoying because it makes me feel the razor is now just that much more lacking. In a way, not getting replacement parts will undoubtedly cause me to the sensible thing; i.e., chuck it and buy another Norelco.

  301. I have very sensitive skin, especially around my mustache, goatee, and neck, and I hate shaving. All in all, this is one of the best things I have every done for my face. The shave obviously is not as close as a razor, but it is very good - if you take the time to feel for rough spots. I just wet my hand and feel around. I no longer dread shaving in the morning. Update: I tried a shaving oil for the last three days, American Crew, and it is even better than shaving gel. I can see all the wiskers, and my face feels great after shaving.

  310. I have owned this unit for a year. Prior to owning this Panasonic I had a Remington rotary shaver. Here are the PROS: - It shaves even the longest 7-day growth without pulling or hurting. - You can take it in the shower & its easy to wash and clean. - It has a neat cleaner machine that will thoroughly clean the unit for you. CONS: - You cannot use it while charging it at the same time (sorry, for those of you who forget to charge until the last minute...although it does charge fairly quickly). - The cleaner unit requires $10-13 'recharge' units every three months or so, which are basically new soap cartridges. It's kind of like the ink cartridge for the printer, except in this case everyone DOES have soap lying around--Panasonic could have easily made this an environmentally friendly mechanism whereby one uses common household soap to refill the cleaning machine; but, they were more concerned about profits in my opinion. - My worst qualm of all is this: my beard hair is bristly and each hair very thick. On my neck the beard hairs tend to grow flat, instead of outward. For some reason this $100+ shaver is practically useless when it comes to my type of hair. It requires 4 to 5 passes over the same area to clear these thick, flat laying hairs. I tried to give the unit to my brother who, after testing it, thanked me for the generosity but insisted on sticking with old school razors. I never had this problem with the rotary blades on my Remington. My next shaver will have rotary action. Good luck to the thick bearded!
  311. If you're an intelligent shopper you're doing some research comparing different shavers and brands. You probably read all of the bad reviews of the new Norelco shavers, and now you're probably between two shavers: the Panasonic ES8109S, and the Braun Pulsonic 7 series. They're both great shavers, and in the end you'll be pretty happy with both. But the Panasonic has several key advantages for you to consider... 1) Braun's \\"superior\\" pulsonic technology makes 10,000 strokes. Panasonic's makes 13,000, for shaving, and a blistering 17,000 for cleaning purposes. 2) Braun's retail price is over twice that of Panasonic's. 3) Braun's shaver CANNOT be used in the shower. The 8109S can. In fact, it's fully immersible, if you feel like shaving underwater! :p 4) Braun's foil is straight, with a flexible head. The Panasonic's head is also flexible, but has a convex foil, which makes shaving under the neck much easier. 5) Both have a nifty cleaning mechanism for their shavers. To the best of my knowledge, the only way the Braun dries the shaver is with a heating element. The Panasonic not only dries your shaver with heat, but also a fan to really air it out. My shaver is bone dry once the drying cycle is over. Also, the cleaning solution for the Panasonic is alcohol-free, which prevents breakdown of plastics and water seals. ... I've owned three Norelco wet/dry shavers, and this is my third Panasonic. I gave the offering from Braun a hard look, but already knowing what kind of quality to expect from Panasonic for half the price, I decided shelling out crazy money for the Pulsonic just wasn't worth it. In the end, I not only saved money, but got my hands on a real gem of a shaver: easily the best I've ever owned, and the closest shave I've ever had. I highly recommend using this shaver with a glycerin-based shaving gel, such as those by Gilette or Nivea with MicroTec. Hands down, the closest shave you'll ever get in such a short amount of time.
  312. Panasonic has a winner with this shaver. Have owned a series of Panasonic electric shavers over the years and this is the best one ever. The shave is smooth and quick. The recharge is very quick. If you run out of charge, 10 minutes in the charger will do enough to give a full shave. The new motor is far less noisy than the older models--you do not need ear protection anymore! The charge indicator is now in percent and is very accurate--no more LED lights that tell you nothing. The cleaner function looks interesting but I have not used it yet. I usually just rinse the shaver using the hot water from the tap and sometimes remove the shaver head cover to rinse inside. I always use shaving lather and it seems to help since it lubricates the skin of the face and makes the shaver slide easier. If you like an electric shaver, this is a good (though a bit expensive) choice.
  313. I could write a lot about the razor but let be simplify it to say, it does not irritate my face any more than my Gillette Mach 5 razor and it cuts as close.   316. I have owned all brands of shavers/razors, and I have to say Braun is NOT worth the money. Not only do they not shave very well, they fall apart within a years time. Even a new blade doesn't help. For the price you pay for those I would have expected more. Now the Panasonic is a razor I can recommend. While they also wear out quicker then I hoped, they do last longer then a year and cost half as much as other brands. But what is more important then stability...does it work? Absolutely! This is my second Panasonic, and I am never going back to another brand. They are affordable and work better then the more expensive brands. The cleaning units us a dry detergent pack with normal tap water. Other brands like Braun use a liquid detergent pack, which is easy to spill, and takes up WAY to much room in a closet or drawer. Not to mention they are harsh and can actually burn your skin or remove the coating on your sink. Why would you put that on your face? Panasonic's cleaning detergent is small, simple, and safe. Some customers complain of the cleaning unit being very load. This model is much quiter then other Panasonic models and way cleaner then Braun or other brands. If you close the bathroom door you won't even hear it. Get this Panasonic and enjoy what shaving is suppose to be like! And if you don't like it, atleast you didn't drop $200 - $300 on one of the other brands.
  317. I have used a few electric razor, but always found my way back to Fusion, Mach 3etc. I may stick with this one. Takes time to retrain to an electric but results are promising! The features and the price make it a winner.

  320. This Panasonic shaver is absolutely amazing. It does everything they say it will, and then some. I highly recommend this product. Ray D.
  321. I've tried the Braun foil, and my last one was a triple headed Norelco. This beats them all. The Braun was a joke, would not cut a beard more than a day old, wouldn't cut the long hairs at all, and never did a good job. The Norelco would shave a 2 day old beard, but not real close (It worked fine out of the box, but replacement blades never seem to be near as good). Very easy to clean, holds a charge nice, and does a good job shaving. ANY electric will struggle with neck hairs under your chin, but this one will get them with a few passes. It's a little noisier than then Norelco, but not that bad- hums more than buzzes. No matter what anyone says, an electric will never shave as close as a blade, but this one does the best job of any electric I've had over the years.
  322. I bought this based on the reviews, which were stellar. However, it's not. As some others have noted, these razors die. They are not sealed well for \\"wet\\" work and water gets in the battery compartment, killing the razor. Signs this is happeing to you include weird display issues. I bought another razor after about a year (only the razor, since I have a base) and the razors sold seperately don't include the connections to charge and clean from the cleaning base. While this razor still works, it is loaded with mildew in the cracks and creavases which the old razor wasn't. I assume this is from the base not being able to clean it properly.<br /><br />That said, it did shave my sensitive face well and with little irritation. Good if you don't mind replacing every 12 months or less. Panasonic won't get me a 3rd time. When I get a new razor both of these and the base are in the trash.
  323. Went from 6 year old Braun to this and couldn't be happier. Very little razor burn and the time it takes for me to shave has been cut in half, even when shaving after a week or 10 days. Used to take 15-20 minutes to shave with the Braun and now it takes a little over 10 minutes for the same kind of shave. This trimmer gets even closer than the Braun, and I have had very little razor burn (the Braun was bad). Wish I hadn't put off this purchase for so long. I actually like shaving again! My only complaint about it is the cheap travel bag. My old Braun pouch will work with this razor and power supply though...
  324. I use mine for head shaving in the shower. It's not as close as a blade, but I can also touch up afterwards. Quality product from a quality name.
  325. I've only been using this shaver for 2 weeks so far but I'm extremely happy with it. The main thing about it is that it does not tug and scrape on my face and so I don't feel all beat up after my shave. I have only used it in the shower and I use a shaving oil and it all works very well.
  326. i've had this panasonic shaver for a few years now, and i hate the darn thing. i bought it because i get razor-burn very badly when i shave my legs with a traditional razor, and i wanted something that was durable and effective and would give me a close shave wet or dry without leaving my skin in tatters. i read all the reviews and finally chose this one. well, on the plus side, this shaver doesn't give me any razor burn and i can use it in the shower, the tub, or in front of the TV. it charges fast and cleans easily, and i really like the drying mechanism (though it is a bit noisy and slow). but unfortunately, it takes me at least 5X as long to shave my legs with this shaver, because it just doesn't get the job done efficiently. when i finally do get a good shave with this, it is a clean, close shave, but it takes forever. i have to make several passes, it doesn't cut most of the hairs, and i have to adjust the angles ad infinitum. and believe me when i say that my leg hairs are not nearly as dense at those on a man's face. if i have this much trouble getting a clean shave on a long, smooth, taut area of my leg (such as the area right next to my shin bone), i would hate to see how poorly it performs on the curves of a man's face or the underside of the neck/chin. i have seen mixed reviews of this shaver, and while it may work for some, it doesn't for me.
  327. I bought this wet/dry shaver, and I've never had such a close shave with any other tool. My wife has remarked more than a few times how close my shave is and how effective the product has worked. I also like the clippers that it comes built-in with, allowing me trim my burns in one quick shot. Overall a great product. I'll stand behind this again and again.
  328. I have been wet shaving for the past 25 years, and have only tried two electric razors, which were very uncomfortable for my face. I have very sensitive skin and a thin build, so it is hard for an electric razor to shave my chin and neck. The Panasonic Vortex solves both of these problems with a little bit of difficulty on the later. The razor has a little difficulty under my chin on my upper neck, so I normally wet shave this area, which seems to always have a few hairs that escape the Vortex, about once every three days. This also keeps any ingrowns from forming in that area. I believe this issue is more personal and wouldn't let it affect the review. The Vortex is easy to clean under the faucet, but it also comes with a charging/cleaning base, which works very well. The razor will alert you when it needs cleaning or charging with a small screen.
  329. This shaver is simply increadible. I have never been happy with an electric shaver until now. It shaves close and fast, with no irritation....even when using it dry. It does everything it the description says. I, like many others here, have used all major brands, but Panasonic has set a new standard....the others have a lot of catching up to do.
  330. I've been shaving with this for about a month now and while I won't go so far as to say that this product has changed my life, it is exactly what I was looking for- a good quick shave. Now I have more time in the morning to spend with my kid, and that is a good thing. I also like that it cleans itself. As far as performance goes, it is just as good as the blade I was using for the past several years. This is my first experience with a foil shaver-- I had used a rotary shaver while in college but switched to the blade as my whiskers thickened up and the rotors pulled them out. Maybe I wasn't using it right, I don't know. Anyway, I've had no problems at all with this.
  331. After reading most of the amazon reviews, I decided to buy this razor and was rather disappointed. Like one other reviewer, I have to go over the same spot several times to get a close shave. My 3 year old Norelco shaves closer even with the original blades. The cleaning station is a plus but I wish that I had purchased the equivalent Norelco model. For my money, Norelco is superior!
  332. I have always had a Braun shaver, but the Panasonic was much faster, quiet, great side burn trimmer and easy to clean.
  333. I have been a blade user forever and I've spent my life in uniform; Marines, police, etc. So I'm used to shaving to inspection standards. I thought I'd try an electric because recently my face has been getting very irritated and breaking out after shaving with a blade. Maybe my skin is changing with age, not sure. I've used an electric in the past for occasional rare quick jobs, but never more than a few times a year. After a ton of online research I bought the Panasonic ES8109S. I've been using it now daily for a week. I have to say, I am VERY impressed with this shaver. The first use resulted in a decent shave but nothing that would pass inspection. It left a few stragglers on my neck. The instructions say to give it 30 days as your face adjusts to the new shaving technique. I figured that was Panasonic's way of saying, \\"Electrics don't shave as good as a blade, but give it 30 days and you won't notice so much.\\" They may actually be right on this one. The shaves now are VERY close with no stragglers left behind. I'm not sure if my face is actually getting used to the new way of shaving, like they say, or if maybe I'm just learning how to use it. But the end result now is a great shave. It's not as close as a blade shave, but it's mighty darn close. I can easily shave with this, put on my uniform and go in for a shift; something I would have never considered with other electrics.<br /><br />The comparison is always made between this shaver and the Braun series 7. I tried the Braun last year for a week; also a very impressive shaver. But I returned it on Braun's money-back program because I just couldn't justify the $260 price. With the Panasonic coming in at the $95-$105 price range I thought it would be worth a shot. The Panasonic is giving me just as good a shave as the Braun did. I don't think side-by-side you could tell the difference in the end result. If you're debating between the Braun and the Panasonic, don't let the prices fool you.The two shavers are every bit equals, with the exception of the Panasonic being less than half the price.<br /><br />The cleaning station works great. The cycle takes somewhere in the 45-minute range. Cleaning an electric has always been a pain for me. Using the little brush has never really gotten a shaver completely clean and it's 5 minutes of time I never really wanted to spend. So I typically cleaned my electrics infrequently. This cleaning system is a no-brainer. Drop the shaver back in the station, hit the button and walk away. The result is a perfectly clean shaver; and I mean just-out-of-the-box clean. There's no reason to skip cleaning a shaver now. As others have mentioned, the cleaning cycle is a little noisy. Not terrible, but if your wife is trying to sleep and your bathroom is joined to your bedroom it may be annoying for her. If you're not trying to sleep and just going on about the house you'll have no problem with the noise. I haven't had any issues with any leaking that a couple reviewers have noted; maybe they're just not completely seating the tank or detergent cartridge.<br /><br />Overall, this is a great shaver and cleaning system. Very impressive shave results at a fantastic price point. Easily a five-star product.
  334. I had an older Panasonic shaver that I got about 6 years ago that I decided to replace with this shaver. This shaver is hands down the best shaver that I have ever used, and best of all, it cleans itself! I would highly recommend this product if you are looking for a good shaver.

I only use it for dry shaving because when using it wet it doesn't seem to get as close to my skin. The cleaning system works great and the shaver looks new every time. The time it takes to completely clean,dry and charge is 1 1/2 to 2 hours, not too bad.   338. I have issues with razor-burn, especially on my neck. I've tried several electric-razors over the years, but typically resort to a standard disposable razor to do the job. I read some other reviews that stated this was a good razor for reducing razor-burn, and they were correct! Of course it's not completely gone, but after a few weeks of use, this razor is performing better than my standard disposable razors: I'm able to shave 5-days/week with minimal irritation! I would say the only downside of the razor (and probably most/all electric razors), is that it doesn't always get the odd hairs that grow in strange directions. After shaving, I occassionally notice a hair or two that just can't be gotten by this razor, despite attempts with different angles and direction of use. However, since it's only a hair or two, once in a while, I simply pull out a regular disposable razor and do a quick clean-up with no problems. p.s. I've been using this razor at the sink with a wet face, wet razor, and Edge shaving gel. I've had no issues with the gel, as I've read others complained of it becoming \\"gummy\\" or clogged after use.

This is not due to the craftsmanship of the shaver; it is due to my own clumsiness. I knocked it off my dresser about 8 months ago and it landed *just* right so as to break off the flip-out trimmer head. Subsequent drops have loosened the detachable foil and foil housing. This week, it landed on the foil and bent both the foil and the blades, causing both to be worn through.<br />My hundred-dollar purchase has paid for itself ten times over in terms of standard shaving paraphernalia and especially razor blades. I recommend this product to those who are sensitive to standard shaving razors, and want more than full value for their money. Panasonic has earned some brand loyalty with this robust device. I will be looking for their newer and better products in the coming few days to replace this workhorse.

  348. [[ASIN:B000VKZMHK Panasonic ES8109S Vortex with Nano Technology and HydraClean Shaving System, Silver]]To set the stage I got the ES8109S about a month ago and I have a light to medium beard. I have been using electric razors for about 25 years and for many of those years preferred the Norelco triple head razor line as it did not pinch like the foil shaver of those days did. The last three razors I have owned have all been Panasonic. The first was the ES8066 and if I used shaving cream it would shave so close I would get nicked but the save was actually closer than a blade (hard to believe I know but true). When used dry it was as good as a blade. When that one died I purchased an ES8095. I used that one for about three years and I am sorry to say that it fell far short of the performance of my first Panasonic. From day one it just did not give as close a shave. Because of that experience I was prepared to give Braun a try this time but when I went over all the electric razor reviews I could find the Panasonic once again sounded the best. I figured I would give Panasonic one last shot and I am happy to say I was not disappointed. This razor is better in every way than it's predecessor. It gives a close, smooth and comfortable shave. It is quiet, well balanced and easy to hold. This is my first razor with a cleaning station and I am amazed every time I use it at how clean the razor is when it finishes it's cycle. All in all I am very pleased with this product so far.

  351. I bought this shaver as replacement of an older Panasonic with linear motor, and I am pleased with the shaver itself. The induction charger of the old model has been replaced by a more ordinary one with a small plug, which consumes less space and weight in my suitcase, and which probably saves production costs as well as energy costs (I think it is more efficient than the induction charger). The only feature of the shaver that should be improved is the fold-out trimmer, which is even smaller than its predecessor and doesn't look and feel as if it has been designed for frequent use.<br /><br />What I don't like is the included cleaning device. I didn't expect such an advanced device with a built-in electric dryer etc. Since I am not planning to use it (cleaning by hand may be less fun for some people, but it seems to be more effective and it definitely costs less effort, time, and energy), I could probably have saved a considerable amount of money by selecting one of the Pansonic shavers that come without the cleaning device.
