It has been a month now... I am a professional, explains to be clean shaven every day.. so that is what I do, Shave every day. And this razor does a clean and close shave that rivals the hand razors. Its dry wet option is good as well. My skin is very sensitive, but this razor does not irritate the skin at all. Did not jump into the next gen in this systems because of the price factor. The cleaning system does take a while, but again you do not use this to clean every day. Charging is pretty fast, for a quick shave just few minutes should be good. Love this razor so far. San.
  450. I was very favorably impressed with this shaver and agree and thank all those who wrote good reports about it before!
  451. I love the close shave I can get with this shaver. I am also impressed with the HydraClean system as it is a big improvement from their old models. The clean shaver icon takes to long to come on and I much prefer the reminder on the Braun models however this shaver is way superior in every other. I am sure it will out last my LAST Brauns 90 day life span. Great quality, battery life, high speed motor and sharp blades make any Vortex Panasonic a good choice.
  452. I'd been using a Braun Activator for almost 5 years until just recently when it started to poop-out and self destruct on me. I tried switching to a blade just to save a few bucks, but I could find no combination of products or techniques that did not result in severe irritation on my neck. Recently, I was at a major club/warehouse store and saw this shaver on sale for $99. I had never used a Panasonic shaver before, but the price was right and I liked that it had the self-cleaning system like my old Braun. Also, the box claims that it has the \\"sharpest blades\\" and \\"one of the fastest motors\\" among its competitors. I don't know how true those claims are, but here is my experience so far: Pros: I am very impressed with this shaver after about one week. As a direct comparison to my old Braun, the results of the shave are as good as ever. Nice, close shave with practically no irritation. However, it seems to one-up the Braun in one very interesting way- the motor never bogs down in the heavy sections of my beard. My old Braun had to be slowly and gingerly moved around my chin hair or else it would struggle, and this happened even with a brand new cutting block and foil. The Panasonic seems to have no issue at all with the chin beard. It just cruises right through the thickest parts with no signs of struggle. And that means less effort on my part, which I appreciate. Cons: The cleaning and drying selections on the stand aren't incredibly intuitive, however. My old Braun just had to be plopped into its stand and it figured out what it needed to do on its own. The Panasonic has options for a few different modes, but I'm not sure which is the best method yet. The instruction manual is pretty useless in this regard as well. The cleaning solution may only last a couple of weeks depending on how often you use it. The more you use it, the longer it should last (what?) even if that's only one month tops. The Braun's solution could last for 3 months usually. Panasonic also claims that the foil and cutting block should be replaced every 12 months. That combo costs $50 (from the manufacturer, could be cheaper through another source) whereas the Braun block and foil were good for 18 months and cost around $40-45 dollars to replace. Not a huge difference, but perhaps something to consider. Also, it sounds like some others here have had issue with the durability of these shavers. I thought my Braun's run of almost 5 years was pretty decent. Hopefully the Panasonic can make a similar run. Conclusion: Given the results of the shave so far, I am thoroughly impressed with this product. Considering that I paid $99 (plus tax), and it shaves as close and comfortably as my old $250 Braun, I don't think I could do any better. I would highly recommend this shaver.
  453. I've used all the other shavers and after 2 months of use I like this one best. Much faster and closer than the norelco(and less irritation), the Remington was so noisy and irritating I only used it for a few weeks, I liked the Braun as well as the Panasonic when it was new but it went downhill from there and didn't improve with new cutter and screen. I've only used this one for two months but so far it's great.
  454. I'm trying to adapt. I'm in the process but this has been really good so far. And the razor is amaizing...
  455. This is my first electric/ cordless shaver and I realy like it,does a great job. I will tell my friends about this product.
  456. I purchased this unit after researching it for 2 weeks and found that for the price it had the best review. I bought it for my husband as a Christmas gift. However, he didn't open it and use it until we came back from vacation because I didn't want to carry the box in my suitcase. When he used it the 1st time it didn't shave around the adams apple very well. He tried both wet/dry with and without shaving cream. The instructions made it clear that it might take 30 days for your beard to get used to it, so don't give up. As is it turned out he tried it for 10 days and it would not make it better. I decided to call Panasonic to get my money back because that's what it said on the book and now they are refusing to give me the money back because it was only for 30 days after purchase (including the day that you buy it online, not even from the day that you receive it). I explained to them that he only used for 10 days and that the waranty said 30 days and they didn't agree. So, if you are going to buy this for a present make sure that if you don't like return it right away or you are stuck with the razor or a re-furbished one. I will never buy another Panasonic product again. Too bad for them because half of my house appliances and electronics are Panasonic but if this is the customer service that they offer it is not worth it.
  457. I used to take the time to shave with a blade - various types - from Bic disposables to the more expensive and \\"advanced\\" multiple blade models. The shaves were always close, but I have always found my neck and mustache area to be tough to shave closely without abit of razor burn or a nick. My beard is medium heavy, although I am no Geico Caveman or Robin Williams.<br /><br />I have also had almost all brands of electrics, from the best models of Norelco, Braun, Remington, etc. Rotary head shavers always cut my neck up, whether they have \\"sensitivity adjustments\\" on them or not. Always. Anyhow, many hundreds of dollars later, I decided to try one of the Panasonic linear wet/dry shavers I had seen advertised for so long. I had 30 days to try it, so I thought I had nothing to lose except a little shipping charge back if it was a dud.<br /><br />Many shaves later - first dry, then with a little shaving gel, I am very happy with this shaver. It provides, after a few gentle passes, a shave I think is as close as any blade ever gave me, without burning me. It's a cinch to clean, and since I don't travel much, working only uncorded does not bother me at all. Battery life is fine. Unlike some reviewers, I am not bothered by the hum or high pitched noise it makes. If you want very fast speed and use an electric shaver, expect abit of noise. Compared to my father's old shaver I recall, this is very, very quiet. If the noise bothers you, either use a blade or perhaps listen to music while you're shaving.<br /><br />I am glad I did not spend extra money for the model with the self cleaning business. Why take up extra counter space with something to put this in, at extra cost, when this is so simple to clean my six year old grandson could do it? This works great, takes up little space, has a nice easy to read display, charges fast, and unless I run into serious problems (although with a 2 year parts and labor warranty I am not worried) in the next year or more, I am sure it can be handled and I might by that time upgrade it. I like the feel in my hand also.<br /><br />Bottom line: If you like electric shavers, don't mind a fast motor slight humming noise, like a close shave with options of wet or dry shaving, and don't want to worry anymore about razor burn or bumps or not getting a close shave, then this is the shaver for you! I would skip the higher end models with \\"self cleaning,\\" since this is so easy to clean, but that's up to you. I look forward to the next improvement on this shaver, but until then I am happy, I got it for less than $100., and if I change in even two years, I got more than my money's worth!by that time upgrade it. I like the feel in my hand also. Bottom line: If you like electric shavers, don't mind a fast motor slight humming noise, like a close shave with options of wet or dry shaving, and don't want to worry anymore about razor burn or bumps or not getting a close shave, then this is the shaver for you! I would skip the higher end models with \\"self cleaning,\\" since this is so easy to clean, but that's up to you. I look forward to the next improvement on this shaver, but until then I am happy, I got it for less than $100., and if I change in even two years, I got more than my money's worth!

Now I know why I have not been shaving clean for all those years. It is a pain, literally, to shave with a blade every day. After reading all of the reviews, and especially the wet/dry capabilities, I decided the ES8109S was the one for me to try. Now, I am glade I did. Although it takes longer to shave than with a blade, especially if you want to get a close (Blade) shave, I can do it every day without any pain or nicks. It feels good to use and can run over areas several times without any burning, even dry. I do have a heavy beard that grows very rapidly.   468. I've used electric shavers for over 20 years, both linear and rotary, and this one is by far the best. I loved my previous Panasonic Wet/Dry, but the ES8109S is substantially better. I've used it for about a year now. It is definitely important to allow a few weeks for your skin to adapt. Reports of razor burn might come from those who are too impatient, pressing too hard or too long in one place while shaving, especially in the first few weeks of use. Keep the razor moving! The battery lasts well between charges and maintains strong motor power throughout the discharge cycle, rather than fading slowly as the battery discharges. The pop-up trimmer works really well too. I use it to clean up my neck, sideburns, ears, nose, and unruly eyebrows. I prefer not to use the pivoting head, so I'm glad that it can be locked in place. I don't use the cleaning function in the base, I only use the base for charging. Manual cleaning is quick and easy. Easy to use, easy to charge, easy to clean, great battery life... A real gem.

  472. Let me start by saying I hate electric razors.That is until now.I'm a Gilette Fusion man,a wet shaver who needs more lubrication than Joan Rivers on date night.I'm 42 this month and have worn a goatee forever.You see for me the most sensitive part to shave has always been the mustache and chin area.The hair in that area is the heaviest and thickest and shaving it with a disposable or anything for that matter left it raw,red and sometimes pimpily.Yes at 42 I still suffer from occasional acne,Mother Nature has a sense of humor. Now my goatee has alot of gray in it and it really makes me look older than I'd like to.So I searched,researched and inquired as to what electric razor could do the job of shaving 10 years off my face.I arrived at the Panasonic ES8109 Wet/Dry Shaver.I'm a firm believer in the art of wet shaving and would NEVER drag a dry razor across my face so the wet feature appealed to me.Here's how the first try went and the products I use to obtain a great shave. First I trimmed my goatee down a bit with the pop out trimmer on the unit,a great feature in itself.Then I took a hot shower to soften up the hair.I fill the sink with HOT water and lube up my face with King Of Shaves Gel.Hands down the slickest most soothing gel ever created! The King Of Shaves line is THE BEST for anyones skin.Tea Tree Oil,Vitamin E and all kinds of nutrients for your face. Now I'm ready.I turn it on and make a few practice swipes above my face to get the feel of the razor and the proper angles.I recall a previous reviewers advice,\\" Keep the razor moving \\", I dip it in the water and start erasing the years. Almost instantly I'm impressed,it's removing hair painlessly and in one or two passes tops.I continue on keeping the razor wet as well as my face.I'm shocked at how close a shave this electric is giving me,the technology for shaving has finally arrived! I finish up shaving off my goatee and am very pleased.No cuts and no irritation and smoooooooth baby! Now remember I only bought this to shave my goatee and it did a great job.But I finish up my shave with a Gilette Fusion Power razor.I've suffered from cystic acne on my neck and cannot afford to experiment on that area.A Fusion with a downward stroke,NEVER upward,does the job for me so if it ain't broke......... That's it,this Panasonic shaves as smooth as a Fusion.The vortex cleaner is sweet,you can charge and dry this baby when you're done and clean it every week or two. All the great reviews are true,this is the elite of electric shavers and should cost twice what you'll get it for on Amazon.Buy the Vortex it's worth it. ......And my last product.Anthony Logistics Ingrown Hair Treatment for Men
  473. This is by far the best electric shaver I have used from the quality of shave I get from it. It's comfortable with no irritation and gets a very close shave for an electric. Not quite as close as a blade but close enough. I have used it shaving dry and wet and had good results both ways but the wet yields the closest shave which I tend to use the most. I generally use shaving gel and it works real well and is convenient being able to shave in the shower. The cleaning base stand works very well and keeps the shaver in tip top order. The cleaning cartridges are kinda spendy and I can't find them anywhere locally so I have to order them from Amazon which is inconvenient. About a month or so ago I purchased my second set of replacement cutters and foil as I tend to change them both once a year. For the past couple months the LCD display started to go out but that didn't bother me as the shaver still worked. Unfortunately last week I hopped in the shower to shave and the shaver was dead. It worked fine the day before and was charged a day prior and when I hit the switch there was nothing. Total bummer! I'm torn on what to do now. I have a set nearly new cutters and foil and two spare cleaning cartridges and no shaver. I've had to go back to me old Norelco 9160XL and it totally sucks! It doesn't get nearly as close a shave.   474. I just received the Panasonic ES8109s Vortex a few hour ago. This will be my first impressions rather than a long term quality review. I think a long term usage review is more useful to know if your hard earned money is being well spent. But I was immediately impressed with the Vortex after the first use, I had to write a review. This is only my second electric razor. I did not enjoy the first, so I switched to a Gillet. The first thing you will notice is the weight and the comfortable handle (I have small hands). It is much heavier than it looks and the build quality is great (so far). Skipping the minor details... After not shave for a week, I shaved dry for the first use. This razor works amazingly!!! My previous experience with electric razors left me with bad impressions of razor burn and skin irritation. So I was skeptical of spending $100+ on another electric. I can tell you, shaving dry is great. No pulling, pinching, and especially NO RAZOR BURN!!!! Who cares if it does not get it it all in one pass. The point is, even on multiple passes, I did not get the usual skin irritation. I consider my skin to be relatively sensitive. Keep in mind I have not used an electric for years and have not had the 30 day face break in period. HERE IS WHAT YOU REALLY WANT TO KNOW: For the actual shave; this thing shaves as close as any straight wet razor. No shaving prep needed (lotions, gel, or any other lubricants). I went from the box to my face. And the results left my face as smooth as if I had used shaving cream and a good straight razor. SMOOTH as a baby's bottom! Spending this much money, for something, is always a hard decision when all you have to go on is the words of others. Rest assured that this product is well worth the investment. I read many reviews on electric razors and I took a chance on this razor. Glad I did.

  477. This is my first Panasonic Razor. I usually buy Brauns. First off let me say that this Panasonic Razor is excellent. When you first take it out of the box make sure you give it a FULL charge for the first time usually takes around 2 1/2hrs to FULL Charge. It takes some time for your skin to get used to this eletric razor, but that really goes for any electric razor...but as soon as your face and neck is used to this razor it is awesome from there! This razor is on the small side compared to other Brands like Braun and Norelco. Since it is on the small side you actually get a good grip of it in your hand which is cool because the razor is under total control with a good grip. The sound is pretty average for eletric razors...not too loud, not too quiet...pretty decent sound. You can actually hear how fast the blades are moving...an amazing 13,000rpms which is fast for an electric razor......Overall I'm satisfied with my first purchase of a Panasonic Electric Razor........I would definately recomended purchasing this Razor....best of all is the price $$$ compared to expensive Brauns and Norelcos....but this razor will give you the same quality if not better then those brands ! Thanks Amazon for the Fast FREE Shipping ! Overall Great Buy !
  478. I had looked at powered shavers with skepticism but Im happy to have been proved otherwise. This is a neat product and I got it at a great price. It does a take a little getting used to, especially for someone who had never used one of these before. The dry and wet functions performs well. My stubble isnt very stubborn and that possibly helps. The battery held up well and the blades did well. I will probably add to this comment in a few months to let you know how it stood the test of time. Very easy to set up and use and it takes around 2-3 passes to catch all the bristles. Used it in the shower too and all in all, an excellent value for the money.
  479. I really looked forward to receiving this product and trying out simply based on all the great reviews it received. Its well thought out, well built, easy to clean and has a lot of potential. The downside was that it took forever to shave. I intentionality grew my beard out (1 week of hair) to test its cutting ability and I was really disappointed. Its a good stubble remover. I eventually had to pull my regular andis shaver and clean the areas that the Vortex couldn't do. It did my cheeks really well but the jaw line, throat and neck all failed. The time I spent trying to get a clean shave eventually irritated my skin leading to lots of razor bumps and then led to me not being able to shave for one week and having to remove a lot of ingrown hairs. I gave it a three because of the hydra clean system and ease to clean, dry and charge. This shaver will compliment your other shavers but definitely will not be a replacement.

  483. My old Norelco was doing a terrible job on my beard. Time for a change . . . I knew I didn't want to go back to the Braun that I had before the Norelco so I read a few reviews and found this Panasonic. The difference is unbelievable! I've been using the new shaver for about two weeks now with Neutrogena shave cream (low foam, great smell) and this is by far the closest, smoothest shave I can ever remember having. I will never go back to dry shaving with one of those other shavers. The Panasonic also has several different selectable functions (clean, dry, charge, etc.) that can be used individually or together for a complete refresh of the unit. After a shave I remove the foil and rinse the foil and cutting head under running water and then put the razor back in the charging stand and use the dry function to dry it for the next use. Then I only use the complete clean cycle once a week or so which should extend the life of the cleaner cartridges. As I say, I've only had this shaver for two weeks but so far I couldn't be happier.

  486. For those of us who prefer a foil headed shaver, this is one of the best I've owned. It holds a charge for a long time, cuts close and smooth, and never irritates my skin. The sideburn trimmer works acceptably, and the % charged display is very useful when anticipating the need to recharge. The charging/cleaning base is something unnecessary, since the shaver is waterproof and can be cleaned easily under a faucet, but it's included. I stopped using mine.

  499. I bought this as my first electric shaver after borrowing and trying many others. I wanted this specifically for two reasons: I have sensitive skin that is easily irritated by shaving with blades, and I was told by quite a few people that this shaver got closer than any other electric out there. In both of those qualifiers, this was a good purchase. This shaver is way easier on my skin than shaving with blades, and allows me to shave twice daily with very little if any irritation. It is capable of achieving a very close shave in most areas, however I noticed it lacking in my neck and the bottom of my chin. I assumed it was user-error that was the problem, so on more than one occasion I tried repeated to get these areas with the shaver only to end up getting nicks and razor-burn. This shaver simply does not get those areas well on some people, and if that's a problem for you, you may want to look at other shavers, or keep a spare blade around (which is what I do). The wet/dry function is nice, I've found that I tend to get really good results by shaving with it in the shower, but the hassle-free ability to pop in and shave with it real quick before going out is also very convenient. Both the cleaning cycle and the shaver itself are VERY loud. As in, loud enough that it WILL wake up someone if you shave in a nearby room. If you work nights or early mornings, you might want to look for something more quiet, as the noise on this shaver has made it difficult for me to shave in my usual habits. Overall though, the performance of the shaver as well as the convenience and versatility make this still a pretty good product.

  510. This is my 3rd Panasonic shaver. The first I dropped and broke. My last one didn't have that so I had to keep it fully charged just in case.<br /><br />I haven't tried the Cleaning System so no comments.   513. I purchased this razor based off of the reviews and the price (about $90). I've always been very satisfied with any Panasonic products I've owned from phones, DVD players, to TV's, so I was pleasantly surprised to see a Panasonic razor in the list of highly reviewed razors.<br /><br />I have very sensitive skin which means shaving is basically a means of tearing my face apart several times a week, the summer is the worst. I've tried different razors with 2 through 4 blades. I've tried shaving lotions, gels, and creams. No matter what combination I tried or direction I shaved in, my face was always left raw in certain places. I've spent 20+ years dreading my morning shave. I finally had enough and purchased this razor to see if it could make a difference. I had tried electric razors early on (15 years ago) and wasn't happy with the results. I was hoping things had changed in the razor industry. It apparently has and to a great degree!<br /><br />Initial Thoughts:<br />When I first opened the box I was surprised at the actual size of the razor, this isn't a lightweight cheap feeling product, it has some mass to it and fits nicely in your hand. Everything feels like it was made from quality materials with high standards of construction. I haven't used the cleaning station yet, I just charged the razor with the cord the first time. A full charge took about an hour.<br /><br />First Shave:<br />I purchased a lotion style shaving cream, it wasn't cheap but I'm willing to spend a few extra bucks if it makes a difference. You don't need a lot of foam or cream, just a light wet coat to give your face a slick feel.<br /><br />The big difference is in the shaving technique. With a regular razor you make 1-2 passes and move on, otherwise you risk razor burn (at least for me). With the Panasonic I found that you can go over the same spot 2-3 times and from different directions to make sure you don't miss anything. You really don't have to worry about razor burn as long as your not pressing hard. I used slight pressure and a smooth long motion like you would normally use, but I did this in 3 directions. My face feels like the shave was nearly as clean as a razor shave, but with zero irritation. I think after 2-3 shaves I'll have a pattern down that works for my particular beard growth.<br /><br />Cleaning was a breeze. I just rinsed the shaving cream off of the head with hot water and held the power button until the razor went into it's 17,000rpm (you hold the power button down for 5 seconds for this) cleaning cycle. I turned the razor off added a little hand soap to the screen and repeat the cleaning process. When I was done I removed the screen, rinsed it out and shook off any excess water. I then rinsed off the exposed blades, shook off excess water, and took a towel to it briefly to remove any visible moisture and set it on the counter to dry.<br /><br />Cons:<br />I really haven't found any at this time. I will probably hook up the cleaning station this weekend to see how it works. It takes up some counter space so I'm not sure if I'll keep there or not. It seems to me that I will spend just as much time cleaning the cleaning/charge station as I would just cleaning my razor by hand after each use, but I'll give it a shot and see if I like using it.<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />So far I'm very impressed with the quality of this razor and the comfortable shave it provided. I will try it out for a few weeks and provide another update. At this point I feel comfortable in recommending this razor based off of the shave I was able to get on the first use.
  514. This is my first electric razor. I spent a long time looking up reviews and this one met all of my expectations. First off it took about two weeks of using it every day for my neck line to become accustomed to it(some irritation/red bumps) and after that it has been smooth sailing. I also use this to keep my head shaved and it does a very smooth job of that as well. I will also add in that I hardly used a razor before mainly because it was very time consuming and at points messy and constantly having to buy blades. I have rather thick hair on my face and head and I would blow through razors like they where going out of style so mainly I just used a beard trimmer to keep it stubbly/short and said to hell with razors but that was also a messy endeavor which left little hair clippings everywhere. So that turned into a once a week ordeal. With this razor I mainly use it everyday(98% of the time). I could go upwards of three days before having to use a trimmer to bring the hair down to short enough pieces for this shaver to do its job efficiently. However, as I said I mainly use it everyday. It only takes a couple of moments to devour the hair that has grown in roughly a 24 hour period it also does this very neatly in the sense that I don't have any hair to sweep up after I'm done. Just pop the head off under the tap(or in the shower) and presto nice and clean and ready to be used. The cleaning/charging base was neat in the beginning but I have since quit using it because I mainly use the shaver in the shower now so a quick pull apart and rinse gets it cleaner than the stand. Now one thing that took the longest to get used to was figuring out which way the hair grows out of my face, razors where much more forgiving in that sense but you really need to find out which way the grain is going and then move against it, for that razor smooth finish so cheeks/jaw where easy it's just the neck/under the chin that gets tricky but very possible just takes some learning. I can pull off a razor smooth finish on my head and face with this shaver and I have been using it for about two months now and I haven't managed to kill it yet and it doesn't feel like the blades are dulling out or having any issues yet. So this was well worth the money though if I could go back I would save some money and just buy the shaver by itself.

  519. I purchased this shaver a few weeks ago when the Braun I had been using for several years finally died. My intention was to replace it with a similar Braun shaver, but I was a little taken aback by the pricing. Instead, I decided to purchase the Panasonic for roughly half the price of the Braun, based on the very high ratings it had received.<br /><br />I have been very pleased with the performance so far. It gives a very close shave for an electric... not as close as a blade, of course, but the closest of any electric shaver I have used. I have not tried shaving with a gel, but I suspect that might even improve the results. It charges quickly and holds a charge well. I took it on vacation recently, and it still had 40% power after daily shaving for 8 days and no charging.<br /><br />The cleaning cartridges are much smaller than the Braun cartridges, but this is because you have to manually add water to a small tank on that back of the charging base. This is slightly less convenient, but much less to throw away.<br /><br />My only complaint about the shaver is that the location and angle of the trimmer is somewhat awkward for trimming a moustache, though it is perfect for sideburns. I've learned to use it effectively, though, so it is only a minor inconvenience.<br /><br />Overall, I don't think you can get a better shaver for the price.

  524. Ok, here are my initial thoughts after four days of use. I bought this razor based mainly on the positive reviews I read here. A bit about my shaving history. First of all I have a fairly heavy beard coming from a Welsh background. For a couple of decades now I had mainly used Norelco rotaries including a high end Speed-XL for the past few years. It would do a sorta ok job on the face and cheeks although no semblance of being as close as a blade but refused to cut the long hairs in the neck. So I would use that as a first shave and then touch up the rough spots in the shower with a blade. Why even use an electric at all? Also because of my sensitive skin by using the blade, I had to skip shaving the next day. About four or five years ago, I tried a Braun Syncro shaver, a foil type like the Panasonic. Where it cut, it cut closer then the rotary but left huge gaps, particularly on the neck and I never could seem to get all the hair no matter how many passes I made. So I was skeptical that the Panasonic, another foil shaver would really be better. From the first day I used this shaver, I knew it was going to be my best electric razor ever. Mowed right thru the hair getting most in the first pass and I shaved my entire face all within a a couple of minutes. Did a great job on the neck as well although the hair was not too long to begin with as I had shaved the previous day. The heads look somewhat similar to the Braun Syncro but for whatever reason, the performance difference between the two is like night and day. In the ensuing four days, it has only gotten better. Already my neck has become de-sensitized enough so I know I'll be able to shave every day. After I finish, it feels in most areas as close as a blade although truth be told, it's not quite because the five o'clock shadow creeps in a bit earlier in the day then it did when using a blade. However as mentioned, I can now shave every day and I think I could shave more then once a day if needbe, something I never thought would be possible. The biggest drawback? The NOISE! It whines like a little jet engine! It is be far the loudest shaver I have used, louder then the Braun and way louder then the Norelco rotary. I live in a condo with my bathroom wall facing another unit and I really hope the noise is not bleeding thru. That is something Panasonic needs to work on and I think I will let them know about it. That is why I'm cutting back on my rating a bit. Performance wise I'd give it a solid four and a half stars. I just used the cleaner setup tonight and it did a fine job. I don't see the need to use it every day. I just tap the hair out after each use and I think using this setup just a couple times a week will be fine. If my mind changes significantly after more use, I'll edit my review. Things I want to try is a wet shave in the shower and to skip a day and see how it handles the extra growth but right now I'm happy I bought the razor as long as the noise isn't bothering my neighbor.
  525. This electric razor will shave you close to a blade razor. You don't even feel it cutting. At first I thought that was weird after using a Nokia Series 7 with rotary blades. The Nokia always left my skin irritated due to constant running of the razor on one spot to get all the hair.<br /><br />The Panasonic will get them with 2 or 3 runs. You can run it deeper and more if you want to get the closest shave and it will not irritate you. It's simply amazing.<br /><br />Some additional features are water based cleaning base (cheaper refills), super accurate sideburn trimmer, and nice display. This razor's price is also a winner. To my understanding it shaves as good or better then high end Brauns or Nokias, but it has half initial and ongoing costs.
  526. After 1 month of using this shaver, I'm convinced it is the best I've ever used. I've been using a Norelco 8865 XL for several years now, and I was pretty happy with it. But if I had to shave 2 days in a row, it was a very uncomfortable experience, with a lot of irritation on my neck. And I also have always used a foil type shaver, currently a Remingtom Titanium and earlier a cheaper Braun, because I couldn't use the 8865 to square off my sideburns with a nice straight line, or get a couple spots under my nose and lower lip. So if I traveled, I either had to take 2 shavers along or try to make due with the Norelco. The Remington gave a decent shave, but it would actually draw tiny dots of blood around the edges of my mouth, which is a bit too close for comfort. Also, I'd use it very sparingly on my neck, as it wasn't as comfortable as the floating triple heads on the Norelco. Now everything has CHANGED! I've found one shaver that does it all in the Panasonic 8109. I think it's amazing. I'm not sure why, but this shaver does not irritate my neck area at all. I don't mean less irritation than the other 2, I mean NONE! I really can't feel a difference on my neck where I did and didn't use the razor. And the shave I get is nice and close. I've never used a blade in my life, so I have no idea how it compares, but it shaves me as close as any shaver I've ever used. This is a shaver and not a magic wand, so it does require several passes to get a clean shave. But I believe anybody who complains that it doesn't shave clean with 1 pass has just never used electric before. I'd love to hear about the electric shaver that can shave clean in one pass, I don't believe it's possible. And I also feel that the poor craftsman blames his tools, and this tool will allow a very good shave when used correctly. As for the self cleaning stand, I'm less enthusiastic. It does work as advertised and is a nice addition, but if price was my biggest concern I would get the lower model Panasonic without the HydraClean. I got mine for $108, minus a $30 instant rebate so it only cost $78. The next model down was $79 with no rebate, so taking the HydraClean version was a no brainer. And it is a cool little toy that does work well, it just isn't a necessity like with the Braun 360. You can put some soft soap into the heads & let them clean themselves because water can't hurt this shaver, unlike the Braun. In conclusion, I'd say the number 1 reason I like this shaver so much, is because after 30 years of hating shaving and the irritation I knew I was going to feel, I actually don't mind shaving any more. Shirt collars don't cause discomfort because the skin feels fine. And shaving 2 days in a row is no longer a dreaded experience, it is actually okay. I would give this shaver 5 stars, but the battery life is a little shorter than my Norelco and I'm saving that 5 stars for a magic wand that I can just wave over my beard and it disappears.
  527. Bought this to replace a middle-of-the-road, one-year-old Braun 4775. The shave quality on this Panasonic is WAY better than the Braun. Compared to a brand new, out of the box blade, the blade will shave closer. But compared to a blade that is a couple of days old, this is at least equal, and compared to a four day old blade, the Panasonic is superior. I do get a few nicks from this each day, but none are enough to need to do anything to staunch the bleeding or otherwise address the issue (which is more than I can say for a 3 day old blade). I use it wet with shaving cream, but not in the shower, since I have no place to put it in the shower when I'm not shaving. Not a perfect shave, but over time, will be far more economical than buying two expensive blades a week. I've also had it 3 weeks and have not used up the first cleaning cartridge yet, and I clean it daily, so that seems to be good too.
  528. Replaced my Braun shaver w/ this unit and am very satisfied with the performance, battery life of the shaver and cleaning unit. This is the first shaver that I purchased with a cleaning unit so I can't compare it with others but for the most part it does what it should. I just wished it had a traveling case. Also be sure not to pour water in the cleaning unit. Overall I highly recommend this shaver and am planning on getting another one for my father for Christmas.
  529. I've been using a Remington 3 blade electric for years. I've preferred to use in the shower but never wanted to spend +$100 to get a good one. Lighten deal + $30 off, I picked this up for $49. Great deal! Great shaver.
  530. Have owned this shaver for a year now and am very pleased. Close shaves, no irritation. I like the self cleaning system. I use the shaver dry and the shave is the same I was getting from a blade. Would definitely recommend this shaver.
  531. I like to shave in the shower to prevent a mess in the sink with hair debris. The last 3 Panasonic shavers I have purchased each lasted at least 2 years, so I decided to purchase the 8109S with the handy shaver cleaner/charger. The batteries last at least 9-10 shaves, and I only need to charge once ever 2 weeks. One of the best shavers I have owned!
  532. I shave my head as well as my face, and this linear Panasonic shavers are a favorite among the cue-ball set. It took me just two years to wear out a prior Vortex Linear shaver. One of the blade-holders broke loose. I briefly tried a top-of-the-line Braun, and returned it. The Nano-line is definitely an evolutionary improvement compared to the Panasonic Linear units of the past couple of years. What you lose (for shaving your head) is a bit of width and flatness that seemed to help make quick work of head-shaving. On the other hand, the shave is even better--- the sound alone tells you this is a very \\"fine\\" cut. It's a \\"zing\\" as opposed to the old \\"chopping\\" sound. And the clippings in the razor or more like dust than bits of whiskers. These new blades are *sharp*. One touch with a fingertip proves it. The razor is quieter than the older linear models, which will be a relief to some. The cleaning unit is improved as well. The power tower is gone, and the process is quieter. It remains to be seen how blades and foils hold up to the extra \\"acreage.\\"
  533. This shaver gives a good close shave. I charge it once a week although it is still about 50 - 60 percent charged.
  534. I am very happy with my purchase of a new Panasonic ES8109S razor. I have used Norelco razors since 1968 my last new one I bought in 2005. With six years of shaving with it,it was becoming useless,so I thought I would try the Panasonic. I am glad I did! No electric shaves as close as a blade,but this one is as close to a blade as you can get without all the nicks and cuts! Just a super razor for the money!

He was thrilled when he got it, his older shaver was about 6 yrs. old I think... Anyway, he loves the auto-cleaning and the fact that he can use it in the shower or dry if he wants. I asked him 2-3 times, \\"what do you think?\\" - he raved! So, I recommend it and can truly say paying more is not necessary. Anything over $85 for a razor is too much (my opinion).
  536. My experience so far: The shaver works better after a couple of uses (in my case I would say after 3 weeks of use). So far so good. Of course, it doesn't do miracles, but it can be used in the car or in other situations when the traditional foam and razor can not be used. Be aware that an electric razor may cut hair that it is not visible in your face (example, the area below your eyes); so I would recommend to use a mirror in order to see what you are shaving.
  537. This is the second Panasonic shaver I've own. The first one lasted me eleven years. This new one is better and shaves closer then the old one. Even easier to clean and charge. Need I say more?! Definitely worth the money!
  538. I've used Braun shavers for years, the last being the 9595. Always had good service from them but the 9595 needed replacing and naturally I started reading reviews of the newer Brauns. I was surprised to see so many average ratings and discovered from several written reviews that Gillette had purchased Braun. At that point I began reading reviews of the other major brands. Anything new to you takes a little getting used to and the ES8109s was no different. I got good, close shaves from the start and noted it was about half the size of my Braun. This shaver is about half as loud and the HydraClean system has more pluses to it than the Braun's. I'm very pleased with my purchase and could summarize the difference between my old shaver and this one as smaller, sleeker, quieter and faster. I'd recommend this shaver to anyone in the market for a new one.
  539. Just bought this item after a lot of consideration and upon reading all the reviews. Back in the day my first shaver was a cheap $40 panasonic which shaved very well but could not shave around the neck area. Later on I upgraded to a high end norelco shaver XL series and at first it seemed great with its 3 floating heads. It did a little better job around the neck area but after every shave my neck would be red and severely sensitive with some light hair still there. I spent $110 dollars and my biggest regret is that i did not return it for the 30 day guarantee (I guess at the time I thought thats the best you can get out of a shaver). Basically I gave up on electric and started using the disposables. Recently the fusion disposables (which are great) have been racking up a bill and its kind of a slow process in the morning. I decided to give the panasonic a try and this time determined to use the 30 day return guarantee. My experience - Usually when I have not used an electric shaver for a while my skin goes crazy red and hurts for the first few shaves. However right out of the box I used the panasonic and went over the neck few times and no burn at all. WHAT? I could not believe this. This is not possible. Some light hair still remained but its just the first shave. This razor is light and smaller than what it appears on the pics. Either way - no razor burn around the neck?!?! I still can't believe this (even after not using an electric shaver for a month or so). This is ridiculous. I almost tore up the receipt because no one will ever take this shaver away from me EVER!. I will continue to use it and post updates but from what I have seen so far i just can't imagine how it would be possible for another razor to be better than this. PS: For the last few years I have been buying panasonic products and have been very very pleased. Recently bought a plasma TV and its amazing as well. Now my first choice for everything is panasonic because have never been disappointed yet. Not sure how long that will last as these companies are cutting costs everywhere.....

  542. This is my first Panasonic brand electric shaver. Earlier I've used foil based Braun shavers for about 10-11 years. Initially I was very skeptical to switch over the brand. But after going through the positive reviews on Amazon I thought of taking a chance. I paid about $200+ on my last Braun... in contrast on this Panasonic just about $89 (1/3rd price of costly Braun model). Unlike my Braun models, this one requires just one recharge per week. I shave every day and shave is definitely better than my Braun model. Another big difference between Braun & Panasonic cleaning, Braun uses alcohol based liquids which dry up fast no matter you use it or not... whereas Panasonic uses soap based. Also since this is a wet/dry model I can clean my shaver under running tap water first and use hydraclean only once a week. I will definitely recommend this model... which is about 1/3rd the price of expensive Braun models but gives you the same or better quality of shave. PS: I've used this for about 2 months now and happy with this model.

  544. This shaver is amazing, it provides a very smooth close shave, with less effort, and is not loud. I purchased the prior model of this shaver, then the battery went bad, I contacted the Panasonic service department, and the representative was very helpful and provided the details and instructions to send my razor in for repairs as it was still under warranty. I sent it Priority Mail, and the delivery confirmation indicated they received it on a Monday; by Thursday that same week I received a replacement! Not only was it a new unit, but also the updated model (ES8109S). I only had to pay for the one-way shipping to the service center. I am very happy with my new Panasonic razor, it performs even better than the old one did when it was new. And the service I received from Panasonic was outstanding!
  545. I replaced a decade-old Norelco rotary shaver with this Panasonic model. Overall pleased, but a few of my observations have been: Pros: Gives a better shave with far less irritation Rotary shaver had difficulty with certain spots (jawline, above adams apple) that this one gets just fine The cleaning feature is pretty slick Shaver itself is compact and easy to handle. Cons: Loud! Razor is much louder than the Norelco, enough that I have to shave in the guest bathroom so I don't wake her up when I'm getting ready in morning. Loud! That slick little cleaning station? It's got a noisy little water pump and an air blower. I don't get to run it before bedtime or after shaving in morning unless I move that to guest bathroom also. Not sure what I'll do when we have guests. Big. The cleaning station is like adding another countertop appliance to your life. Approximately the same size as a small blade-style coffee grinder. Other thoughts: Battery life...maybe too early to tell, but in two shaves I dropped to 80%. At that rate, I'll only get about ten shaves per charge. My Norelco gave me almost twice that, despite being many years old. I guess making all that noise requires extra power...

It produced a clean smooth shave every time, right up to the final shave. I thought I would take a break and return to wetshaving, specifically double-edge safety razors, but I hope my future electric razors can give me the satisfaction that this did.   573. This shaver is very good when it is working. It gives a very close, comfortable shave. The problem is that although it is stated to be, this shaver is not watertight. A few months after 2 years owning this shaver (hey, the warranty is for 2 years. What a coincidence!) The display started going wonky, showing random characters that made no sense. No biggie. I never really looked at it anyway since I just keep it in the cradle to keep it charged. Next thing that happened was the blades stopped moving properly. They would just vibrate in a strange manner, not enough to actually cut (no, it wasn't the turbo clean mode). Having no other choice I opened up the razor and low and behold the entire inside was corroded with a brown sludge. (see pictures above) Awesome. Keep in mind I never used this in the shower or anything, only rinsing under the faucet. Since I like the shaver, apart from this flaw, I ordered the ES8103 as a replacement which is essentially the same shaver. Please note, however that the ES8103 does not have the recharging nubs on the back like the ES8109 does so you can't charge it in the cradle. Thanks Panasonic! Anyway, I'll be using the ES8103 without water this time as I have no doubt that water would condemn this shaver to the same fate as before. You have been warned.
  574. Hey I have used a power razor all my life, for the last 40 years or so.<br /><br />This Razor is the best of the newer razors on the market today. I miss my norelco from 20 years ago because it gave the best shave.<br />This razor does a good job. My neck hairs are very tight and lay very flat. This razor needs to be run over my neck in every possible direction in order to have a close shave. If you are in a hurry and do not take your time then it wont be close. I wear a tie all day and when I do not have a close shave my wiskers rub my shirt collar all day and makes my neck red and bumpy.<br />The razor is Good to Great 4 stars<br /><br />Now the cleaning gizmo....2 stars, Great Idea but has many downfalls. First, what is it supposed to do...clean your razor and then air dry it while charging it back up for the next use and it has some lube in the cleaner to keep the blades nice and sharp and ready to go.<br />Sounds great right? Well, I get done shaving I take off the screen and rinse the head in the water faucet so the Cleaner last a month. The cleaner is a bit expensive a $3 or 4 dollar expense a month. Then you put it in the cachine heads down and hit the button to turn it on...all three lights turn on....but the unit might actually not turn on and the next day you still have a wet razor to use...I like a dry razor in the morning. If it does turn on it will fill the chamber holding the razor with the cleaner and run on a very high speed to get the hairs to fall out. Then it drains and a blower turns on and dries the razor, or it should anyways....It might not turn on and now the next morning you have not only a wet razor but a musty smelly razor to boot...I REALLY HATE THAT ON MY FACE.<br />Then sometimes it works properly.<br />Once a month or sooner if needed you have to clean the cleaner. You first unplug the unit!!!! You remover the fluid chamber and pour out the now somewhat milky water...you will find that just pouring out the fluid is not enough to cleanit. You will want to use bleach water it so it is clean and not smelly. Then you remover the cleaner cartridge...I rinse my razor after ever use before I let the machine clean the razor, so my cartridge is pretty clean not tons of hair in the filter of the cartridge so I know it will last a month. Now before you put in a new cartridge I use some dial soap and water in the cleaner chamber to clean it good... Every couple of months I have to use a tooth pick to get down in the cracks and ridges to get the hair out. You have to be very careful and not get the actual unit wet on the outside because the unit is not water resistant and you will ruin it.<br />The cleaner is a great Idea for sure but for a $150+ razor I would think in this class of razor in this price point that the cleaning machine would be as good as the razor remember that the cleaning unit has a monthly cost of cleaner cartridges of $4 a month so in a years time you are in the $225+ level of razor....the razor is 4 star the cleaner is 2 star and that is being nice.<br />I hope this helps...buying a good razor is important and worth the money over the years of service you would expect from the razor....long before this razor dies I will cough up another $200 for a razor that does not have the cleaner unit.

  581. I've had this electric shaver for 3 1/2 years and overall think it is a great electric shaver. It gives you a close and quick shave if you lack time in the morning to do a proper shave. I only replaced the blades once while owning it ($32) and the cleaning cartridge twice (packs of 3 for $9 a pack). I have even used the shaver a couple of times in the shower. I do not recommend this however because the steam can get inside the LCD. I thought I had broke it but after the water inside dried out it came back on. I have never owned any other electric razors and don't see the need to either because this gets the job down for the fraction of the price of more expensive brands like Braun and Norelco.<br /><br />Cons: I've noticed as time passed on the &#34;Cleaning&#34; function on the dock became less effective. Also, the docking station is loud if that's something your conscious about, I can hear it from across the house in my bathroom. The dock itself easily gets dirty, especially if you have it around your sink. As you can imagine, after 3+ years of using it the shaver itself has build up in places that aren't easily able to clean. The biggest problem I have about it is that because there's a lot of moving parts to the setup, it can be tedious to clean.<br /><br />Overall this was a great electric shaver for the money. It still works for me I just decided to try traditional DE razor blades instead because I prefer simplicity and the ability to easily keep my shaver clean. However, if you're looking for a close, quick shave this Panasonic can very well be the answer for a fraction of its competitors.
  582. I selected this razor based on buyer feedback found at Consumer Reports. 15 users all left similar feedback in terms of how close the shave is and ease of use. The comments were left by both men and women. After receiving the shaver, I charged it up and tried it out. The claims are 100% accurate. This foil razor really can claim to shave as close as a blade. I have only tried to dry shave and was thrilled with the results. I have not tried the auto clean feature yet, but CR reviews spoke highly of that too. I expect that the auto clean feature will be equally effective.<br /><br />Be aware that the auto clean feature uses a special cleaning cartridge that must be replaced after 30 cleaning cycles. Plan to spend periodically to replace the cleaning cartridge. According to the manual, the shaver can be cleaned under cold running water and air dried if you opt to buy the shaver only.<br /><br />Anyone that isn't happy with this razor either isn't using it right, has a defective unit, or holds unrealistic expectations. The razor is truly superb.
  583. I've been using this Panasonic electric shaver with nano blade technology (ES8228 or ES8109S) for the past 2 months and love it. Without exaggeration, it gives me the closest shave ever, and I've been using the top of the line electrics from Norleco and Braun for over 20 years. I have compared the Panasonic shaver with nano blades with the Braun Pulsonic and Norelco Arcitec and found that the Panasonic gives me the closest shave. Dry shaving will also give you a close shave. You won't regret this foil beauty, and you can't beat the price.
  584. Here's my situation, I'm fair skinned and somewhat acne prone. I've used a top of the line Braun in the past, which extremely irritated my skin. Switched to the old mug soap and top of the line razors from Mach3 to Fusion, but for me, cuts way to close and at times would leave me in a bloody mess. My next venture was with the Philips Norelco Advantage and then the updated Cool Skin. These worked well..........but still not 100% So while reading the reviews here, and seeing that there was a 30 day money back guarantee, I figured I'd give it a try. I hoped that this time, with the technology advancements, I'd have a winner. Well, here it is! This is absolutely the best shave I ever received from any electric shaver.....PERIOD! This thing is incredible, no irritation immediately after shaving and no skin breakouts the next day. I use it strictly in wet mode and it does what it's supposed to do, and does it well. From the other popular brands and more expensive price tags, this shaver is an under rated sleeper. THANK YOU PANASONIC!!!!!
  585. I got this device after using my dad's ES8077S (which is also a great shaver mind you). I get a closer shave using this guy than a blade, let me qualify that... I am susceptible to getting ingrown hairs when I shave against the grain, so I don't. Shaving with the grain is a quick, easy and painless process however you don't get anything resembling a close shave! My solution? I use the ES8109S in the shower with a little bit of soapy lather and I get a comfortable, quick and dead close shave (especially when compared to using a blade). The LCD display is overkill in my opinion but I guess they have to justify $130 somehow. Remember, you have to shave everyday when using an electric to see optimal results. I have to agree with a previous reviewer however regarding noise. The shaver itself is not very loud in my opinion however the cleaning process is a noisy one. I'd give this product 4.5 stars but have not been given that option so I am rounding down. A great Shaver!
  586. Ok, so this is my third Panasonic wet/dry shaver in about 5 years and, by far, this one is the best one yet. I've experimented with other manufacturers' shavers over the years, including Brauns, Norelcos and Grundig shavers, but I've ultimately found nirvana, ok, not quite nirvana, but a most pleasant shaving experience with Panasonic shavers. I love Panasonic's shavers because I like being able to shave in the shower with an electric shaver and a little glycerin based shaving foam (Gilette Series foam in the long silver tube works best for me and doesn't gum up the shaver like gels do). I swear, this unbeatable combination (i.e., shower steam, Panasonic wet/dry shaver and Gilette Series foam) shaves me closer than even the best blades that Gilette offers (at present, the Gilette Fusion) with far less irritation and with no annoying little cuts in conspicuous locations around my face and/or neck. Just to review, my first Panasonic wet/dry was great and served me well for about 3 years, but when the Panasonic models came out a few years ago with the Vortex cleaning systems, I just had to have one, so I moved on to the model ES8078 wet/dry shaver. The ES8078 served me well for a year-and-a-half - until I dropped that bad boy in the shower earlier this week! 'Nuf said. It didn't break into a zillion pieces or anything, but the motor just stopped working. (It's actually kinda funny because I was so preoccupied with ensuring the safekeeping of that little shaver ever since I brought it home, chiding my poor wife for even looking at it wrong, and then my dumb arse drops the dang thing in the shower. AAARGHHHH!!!) Anyhow, after a quick review of the top of the line shavers from various manufacturers currently available (including the new Braun Pulsonic models), I opted to go for the latest offering from Panasonic. Even though the new Brauns cost $100 more than the Panasonics, their motors are still slower, and you still can't shave with 'em wet. For the uninitiated, higher motor speed = faster moving blades = less friction = less irritation. Panasonics have consistently had the highest motor speed available in any electric shaver. I've shaved with the new ES8109S shaver for a few days now, and my first impression after the very first shave was that I got a very close shave (consistent with the performance of my prior Panasonics) and, try to understand this, my face did not FEEL as though I had just shaved. It may sound a little odd, but you know how your face feels sensitive to the touch after you typically shave? Well, that sensation, at least for me, was far less apparent after shaving with the new Panasonic. Heck, maybe it's the new curved blade and foil assembly that reduces irritation or something. In this respect, the new ES8109S actually outperforms Panasonic's prior top of the line offering (the ES8078) and actually causes even less shaving irritation than that model (which itself wasn't all that irritating to begin with). Also, much like the prior models, the little pop up trimmer on the side of the new shaver is great not only for trimming sideburns (which I actually never use it for), but also for capturing those awkward little hairs that lie flat or may be becoming ingrown. The latest model is also quieter than the last model and has a more substantial feel to it while holding it. Oh, one more thing, the ES8109S comes with Panasonic's latest iteration of its Vortex Cleaning and charging base, which is slightly different from its prior models, but appears to use the same cleaning cartridge. The Vortex quietly cleans, lubricates and even fully recharges your shaver for you (alternatively, you can just plug the power cable for the Vortex directly into the shaver to recharge it). The cleaning/lubricating solution in the Vortex consists of a slender cartridge containing a detergent based solid that becomes \\"activated\\" when it mixes with water in the Vortex base. The cleaner is not alcohol-based, so it does not evaporate over time like the Braun cleaning solution does - along with the money you'll spend on their big, expensive refills. In summary, I highly recommend the Panasonic ES8109S shaver to persons like me with sensitive skin that is prone to irritation (I know you're thinking, \\"Why didn't he just say that from the outset?\\") Hope this review helps! LONG TERM UPDATE! - Well, I've had 8109S for almost one full year now and it's still going strong. I've noticed it's become slightly less efficient at capturing the few hairs on my cheeks that tend to lie flat, so it's about time for the annual changing of the foil, which I know (based on past experience with Panasonics) will restore the shaver to its fullest hair capturing & cutting potential. One tip I have about cleaning the razor - I shave and rinse clean my shaver every day, and I only clean it in the Vortex when it needs charging which, for me, is about once every two weeks. This cuts down on the usage of the cleaning cartridge. The need to clean your shaver will depend in large part on what you shave with (I use a foam, which tends to rinse cleaner than creams and gels). Also, one more tip regarding the cleaning cartridges in the Vortex cleaning system - you DON'T HAVE TO replace the cleaning solution at the manufacturer recommended interval. You can definitely get away with using them longer. I tend to use them until the service light on the Vortex base turns on, then I change the cleaning cartridge and water in the Vortex and it's good to go. I'm only on my third cleaning cartridge in the year I've owned the razor. EVEN LONGER TERM UPDATE! - Well, it's a little over a year-and-a-half since I purchased this shaver, and it has died on me. It all started about two weeks ago when I noticed that it was holding less of a charge between chargings, i.e., I could get progressively less and less shaves per charge. Then the display started giving unintelligible readings that did not correspond to the charge level. Then, today, I go to try to turn on the shaver and no response. All in all, this shaver performed exceptionally well throughout it's lifespan and, considering the price of \\"next-best option\\" Gillette Fusion blades, was far less expensive, and less irritating, over time than shaving with blades. I have to admit I thought it would've lasted me a little longer than it did as past Panasonics I've owned have lasted longer. Now, I could try to have this thing repaired for some astronomical price, only to have it stop working again. Or, I could take this opportunity to purchase Panasonic's latest offering, the Arc IV Nano Men's Wet/Dry Rechargeable Shaver, which I've scoped out and seen positive reviews of here on Amazon. I think I'm going to go with the new Panasonic, but this time without the Vortex cleaning base as this was the 2nd Panasonic shaver I've owned (one of which I dropped) that I am now stuck with a useless Vortex cleaning base. Happy shopping!

It actually shaves my neck smooth which is something that I've only been able to do with blades. The best part is the complete lack of irritation. I have a very sensitive neck and I have yet to need any lotion to sooth irritation. I shave in the shower so the fancy cleaning system is pretty much a waste of space but I do love the Lithium-Ion battery technology. The only shortcoming is the lack of a lanyard. I've dropped more than one slippery shaver in the shower over the years. They generally don't tolerate too many drops to the tub floor before they fail! If they can put a lanyard on a fancy digital camera they can put one on a fancy shaver!

If I had to do it again, I might not get model with Hydraclean system, just double clicking on button drives motor to higher rpm, stick it under faucet and its clean!

  592. I bought the Panasonic ES8109S Vortex Wet/Dry Shaver with Nano Technology and HydraClean System, at age 50 (still young in my book). It is my first electric razor. I did a good bit of research and was looking at another razor which has commercials being aired all day long. This commercial claims that it really gets the neck very well and the new design allows for an overall new electric razor experience. Well, I have been shaving for some time now and I like a very close shave. I use a wonderful Body Shop shaving cream and a great set of blades and razor. I get incredibly close, it is amazing, though it takes a long time; and, occasionally it will leave my neck a bit rough and red. Still, it works wonders. However, with my job and the amount of travel I do, overnight flights, right into meetings and so on, I wanted a way to clean up a bit, and fairly fast. The electric razor seemed like a good place to start. So, I researched the razor described above, from the commercial, and while its overall rating was quite good, the negatives were real and very concise, especially about its lack of quality in the neck area, the very thing it was selling so hard. I continued to read reviews, mostly on Amazon, but also other places and I kept coming back to the Panasonic ES8109S Vortex Wet/Dry Shaver. The reviews were positive, it scored slightly higher than the one being advertised, it was said to handle the neck very well, that it was quiet, held a charge, plus it also had the self cleaning device, if one wanted to use it. And, of course, it could work in the shower, with my favorite shaving cream, or without. It also was much less expensive due to a great Amazon sale. I went for it. I fell in love the first time I used it. That time I used my shaving cream. The next time I did not and for just over a week now I have used it in the dry mode. I have not gotten irritation, though I moisturize right after shaving. It handled the neck better than I expected, the cheeks and side burns come out much smoother than I though an electric razor could get. This razor has a number of options, a number of ways to clean it, including the self-cleaning/charging system (doing both at once). It has a nice pivot and the very finely crafted foil glides across the face, at least my face. I did NOT buy it because of the money, I was prepared to buy the one advertised and $70 more. But, with the special, well, that was the tipping point, though how it worked and the reviews were the deciding factor. Also, if I am not pleased with something, if it doesn't live up to its advertising, I will return it (always politely, but return none-the-less). If you are looking for your first electric razor or a replacement, I strongly suggest you give this a try. Amazon is a great place for just this purpose. Their policies allow a great deal of freedom when shopping and it works to the buyers favor. I will NOT be returning this razor. I know it hasn't been long, but I can tell already, this is a winner. Take a shot - try it. I believe you will be pleased. No matter what you buy, good luck in your shopping.

  596. I purchased this Panasonic razor after reading the reviews thoroughly for the Panasonic and most other razors offered by Amazon. I've been using a blade for decades, but decided to try an electric razor to see how close it comes to the excellent shave provided by a blade.<br /><br />My first purchase was a Norelco Arcitec. I used it for 3 weeks, and sent it back (thanks Amazon for your return policy!) I had to shave several times a day - and it just wasn't worth it.<br /><br />Back to the Panasonic. THIS is the one to buy. I had a Braun that I used once in a very long while, but the Panasonic excels in comparison. The noise from operation is fairly quiet, and very tolerable. Best of all, the motor provides a \\"linear\\" performance throughout the battery's charge, and doesn't drop off as the battery charge is diminished. It is equally effective at a 10 percent remaining charge as it is at 100 percent.<br /><br />The head \\"floats\\", or can be locked in place, similar to a shock absorber - a great feature. I like the feel of the floating head, as it makes it very comfortable and equalizes pressure. If I need it, I can lock the head, but have rarely found the need. It's a very comfortable razor.<br /><br />I purchased the Panasonic when Amazon was having a great sale, and ended up paying about $75 for it - a bargain.<br /><br />Cleaning is done by using the \\"cleaning fluid\\" in the charger, which works well, or by putting a small amount of liquid soap on the razor and letting it run until it \\"foams\\". I'll probably use that latter method the large majority of the time, and the \\"cleaning fluid\\" once in a while to ensure it's nice and clean.<br /><br />I'd recommend this razor for the person who prefers a blade, but wants to try something different. It's a wet/dry razor, and I've used it both ways - and it works great!<br /><br />I received the razor just before a trip to Alaska for my son's wedding. We were only going to be there 3 days, however the SeaTac airport snow closure resulted in our being stranded for 9 days before we could fly home. The battery held the charge the entire time, and worked well - good thing, since I left the charger at home.<br /><br />The side burn trimmer is excellent, and very handy in trimming unruly hair - I'd imagine it would do a great job for trimming mustaches, although I don't have one. The razor handles the sensitive neck area very well, and does an excellent job.<br /><br />I couldn't be happier with this product. An excellent value for the Amazon price!

  598. This shaver actually works fine. It is the cleaning system I have an issue with. My last shaver was a Braun and I replaced it with the Panasonic after several years of service. The difference is, the Braun always seemed clean after a cleaning while the Panasonic did not. Braun uses an alcohol based cleaning solution. It evaporates over time so you con only use it so long. but the shaver feels/smells clean every time you run the cleaning program.<br /><br />Panasonic chose a water based system. While I believe it was clean (most of the time), it just didn't seem as clean, and when the cleaning fluid was near the end of its life, it wasn't clean. There were times I had to rinse it off in the sink because it smelled bad after a &#34;cleaning&#34;. So, did I use the fluid longer than I was supposed to? I don't know, likely with both shavers. with one of them it didn't matter, and the other one had no way to remind me it was time to change.

The battery lasts for 9 of my shavings! and if it goes off during a shave (not very likely) it takes 5 min to charge it enough for finishing the job.   621. I use an electric razor 4 days a week and have been for the last 8 years. This is by far the best system I've used. I came from a Braun system and was not impressed, but kept with it for about 3 years until it broke. This is the first time I shave with an eletric razor that I feel it can get as close as a traditional razor. I'm also liking the cleaning base.<br /><br />Performance:<br />As I mentioned this thing can get as close as a normal razor does. If I'm patient and go over the same section enough I do feel like I've shaved with a normal razor, but I normally don't have the patience. The great thing about this razor is I don't get near the razor burn I did with my other electric razors, so I can go over the same section over and over if I feel like it. I still get a much better shave than with any other electric razor even if I'm in a hurry. Going against the grain has the best results that I've noticed.<br /><br />The battery life on this thing is amazing. It has a % indicator and I haven't noticed it drop below 100% even after longer shaves. If I had to guess, you could probably go 10-15 shaves without needing a charge.<br /><br />Charging/Cleaning Base:<br />This is a huge improvement over the Braun system. Instead of a large alcohol filled container you need to replace monthly, you get compact hard soap filled catridges that last much longer. You actually fill the base with water yourself and then it mixes the soap and water whenever you run it through the cleaning cycle. It says you can use tap water, but if you have hard water I would recommend distilled/purified. It doesn't need much water and you only replace it when you replace the cleaning catridge. Another huge improvement over the Braun system is that if I feel like just charging and not cleaning my razor I can do that easily. It has different modes so that I can set it to charge and clean or just charge. There is also a drying mode, but I haven't figured out a good use for that yet. This is much better than having to unplug the charging cable from the base to plug directly into the razor if I didn't want to go through the cleaning cycle and waste the cleaning cartridge. I've been using it for about 2 months and haven't replaced the cleaning catridge or the water and still get excellent results. I usually run the cleaning cycle every other shave. The best part about it is that the cleaning catridges cost about half of what they did for the Braun system.<br /><br />Overall I'm extremely happy with my purchase and don't think you can get much more for your money.
