  625. This shaver sounds rather whiny. Not pleasant. It does OK on short stubbly stuff but tends to miss stuff that's longer or not stiff. If I need a clean shave I have to go over it with a razor. It has some lights that default to blinking. The designers apparently thought I needed a mini lightshow in my bathroom.<br /><br />Pros: so far it has held a charge for 10 or more days while traveling. Having a base is a real plus.
  626. I have a very tough beard at several odd angles. I was skeptical about replacing my old razor, but the old one was ten years old. This Panasonic from day one worked better than my other brand ever did. I only use it dry shaving, but it gets through tough patches of beard and it feels like I used a blade and cream. It takes a bit longer on a four day beard, but still does the job! Not sure how it will do with water, but I've had this for several years and other than occasionally replacing the blade (as expected) it works like new. Best razor I've used. I would hesitate moving to a different brand.
  627. Bought this shaver for my boyfriend and he loved it. This shaver does a good job. Easy to clean, easy to use. Smooth shave.
  628. This product is my first electric shaver. I have researched online to find the right product that doesn't have too much maintenance and spare parts to purchase. So far I am pleased with the product. It does charge quickly, you have the option to shave dry or wet. I prefer the ladder. When the unit is wet, you can set the dry option in the charger to remove the water in it.. It comes with a power cord that can be used to connect to the charger. If travelling you can take the cord for a corded shave. It does old charge for a great amount of time so you don't have to charge it every three day. I usually do it once a week.
  629. The Panasonic ES8109S still gives me a good close shave after a year of use, even though I haven't yet used the cleaning fluid..
  630. Still using it after a few years, and still working well.
  631. I've had this electric razor for 5 years and it still works like a charm! Honestly I hardly clean it anymore and have NEVER changed the blade inside. I travel A LOT with this razor and one thing that really sticks out for me is the battery life. I can probably go about 2 weeks without charging it and using it for 3-4 minutes each time. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a proven, reliable, charger.
  632. I use it strictly dry. Does a good job.
  633. This product has high RPM but you must move slowly across your face and exert some pressure to get a 'close' shave. Even after doing this my beard (slow growing) has a stubble at the end of the day which I've never had before. Comfortable shave with no irritation. Recharges well and cleaning system seems to work well. Only had it for about a month. Cleaning 'soap' seems expensive (according to enclosed brochure) although I haven't actually searched for any. Haven't used it in the shower or tried to clean it with hand soap........
  634. Lets get right to it.<br /><br />I bought this item on March 17th, 2011 for $59.99 and have been using it for a little over a year now. I am a 22 year old Pakistani-American and have thick facial hair.<br /><br />Pros: Overall, on the cheeks, the product works fine. In fact, since its electric, I'm also able to go against the grain which gives me a much smoother shave than a traditional razor blade. Very pleased with that. The cleaning system also works fine and there are no major technical downfalls.<br /><br />Cons: This product just simply doesn't work on neck hair. After a normal run through, I'd have to go back 3 or 4 times all at differing angles to clean up the neck hair--and even then it doesn't catch them all. I'd usually have to supplement shaving my neck with a razor blade. Another downside I found was that contrary to most other men reviewing here on Amazon, the electric shaver took LONGER for me to shave. Even on the cheeks, after a good shave, I'd see little hairs poking out that I'd have to go back to. With a traditional blade, even with my thick hair, I'd have the initial shaving with little pulses until the area is clean and follow up with a new lather and new shave. With this electric razor, I literally have to go through it 3 times until it catches everything.<br /><br />Overall, I would not recommend this product to men with thick facial hair (especially if you have thick neck hair). If you have thin hair, then perhaps this would work. I just shaved with a blade for the first time in a year and was amazed at how short it took me. I will post pictures of my facial hair for reference to compare in 4 days.<br /><br />If you've any questions, just shoot em here.
  635. I recently bought this electric shaver from panasonic after a lot of search and going through the reviews that others posted online. I have been using it for almost a month now and I feel pleased with my decision to go for this. The good things about this shaver are:<br /><br />1) It gives nice smooth and close shave<br />2) The head can be locked at a position and also can be left otherwise which helps it to move smoothly over your skin.<br />3) It is rechargeable and the best part is that it can be charged while you are travelling other countries that have 220 volts instead of 110 volts that we have in USA.<br />4) The battery lasts long once it is fully charged.<br />5)Last but not the least it comes with a cleaning system.<br /><br />Till now I am pretty pleased and will definitely recommend this product to those looking for a good and long lasting electric shaver.<br /><br />Thanks,<br /><br />Abhishek Kala
  636. The Panasonic ES8103 and 8109 (they're the same) shave well when they work. I have owned 3. But there are two big problems with both. One problem is the battery. It just doesn't last. Yesterday my shaver died after less than one year. My two other shavers also had battery and charging problems. The other problem is the little screen that indicates how much charge is left. That screen begins to lose characters and definition within weeks and after a few months they go blank, meaning that you don't know how much charge is left. These Panasonic models will give you a good shave if you plan to use them for just a few months and them throw them away. If you hate wasting your money and want to have a good shaver that will last a reasonable amount of time, then buy a different brand.
  637. My husband said this was the best razor he ever had. He has very sensitvie skin and this works perfectly for him.
  638. This is a horrible horrible product. After about 30 days of use it started pinching and pulling my skin and left a red spot and here and than and I thought my skin was too dry.   639. I was hoping this new shaver would be significantly improved over the Braun Model 7526 I've been using for a dozen years, but it isn't. It isn't any faster and doesn't shave any closer, if as close. I do like the fact that I can use it in the shower and wash it with soap and water.
  640. I've had and used this razor for over a year. I still use my old Panasonic ES8068 from years ago. It's heavy and fairly quiet and very reliable. This new Panasonic is very loud (to the point where you wonder if you are damaging your hearing) as well as uncomfortable to hold. Where you would want to hold it while shaving you can't because you will cut it off. Panasonic even knows this because it is mentioned in the directions - so why didn't they just design it differently? It also gets very hot during your shave which the old versions never did. This razor needs a redesign badly! The cleaning system is its strong suit and I've used this poorly designed razor for over a year because I liked the cleaning system so much. This month I bought an upgraded Norelco with a cleaning system so this Panasonic is on its way to Goodwill. I would not recommend this razor for the money. Their MUCH cheaper battery powered ES4815 is a better design and I travel with that razor a lot and give it 5 stars for the money.
  641. The razor shaves well, no complaints there. The wet/dry is great. The pop up beard trimmer on this razor is virtually useless, I would recommend buying a dedicated trimmer if you need one. The charging/cleaning base is a bit large, but not too large. The cleaning modes do take forever to run their cycle, but hey, at least you don't have to be around for it to do its job.<br /><br />Update**<br />The cleaning base has died. It no longer will cycle through. It stalls when it gets to the drying cycle. Sad since I only used the cleaning cycle about a half dozen times in the time I have owned it, due to how long it took to clean. -1 star for dead cleaner.
  642. My husband says that this razor has ruined him for any other saver. According to him: it gives a closer shave, is easy to use, and the self cleaning function is great.
  643. Very convenient to shave in shower. This shaver does a good job. Easy to clean. I've owned it for about a year at approx 5 shaves per week and it still holds charge over 8-10 shaves.
